loans.name: Victoriana Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias laboriosas, lo coordina la señora Pilar de 44 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva y cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años con ayudad de su compañero de vida que le dio un aporte financiero para que impulsara su negocio, para mantener el negocio la socia solicita el crédito para invertir en productos como es camisetas, blusas, ropa interior, cremas corporales, perfumes para dama, perfumes para caballeros, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Darling de 26 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos desde hace seis años a las pobladores de su comunidad, Anelia de 33 años de edad ofrece el servicio de comidera en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, y Nubia comerciante de ropa y calzado de manera ambulante desde hace tres años.
texts.en: This group consists of four hard-working members. The coordinator is 44 year old Pilar, who is married and mother to two children. She sells new clothing and cosmetics to members of her community. She started this business 2 years ago with help from her husband who gave her financing to launch the business. To maintain the business she seeks a loan to invest in products such as t-shirts, blouses, underwear, body cream, women's perfume, men's cologne, etc.  The other members of the group are 26 year old Darling who has been selling cosmetics from her home for 6 years, and 33 year old Anelia who has been selling home-cooked food from her home for 5 years, and Nubia who has been working as a street vendor selling clothing and shoes for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, underwear, body cream, women's perfume, men's cologne, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's group is comprised of hardworking women. Rebecca is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past four years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which rears chicken. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy feed and chicks, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to start a restaurant. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for lifeskills training.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos Evaristo tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos dependientes, vive junto con su conyugue en el caserío de Chafan, una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de lima, cuenta con fincas fruteras de lima, dichos productos lo vende en la ciudad de Chiclayo cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, además el cliente cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el cultivo de lima y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Evaristo is forty years old, married, and has three dependent children.  He lives together with his spouse in the village of Chafan, a rural area in the district of San Felipe.  Here, the people are dedicated to agriculture, trade, and livestock.  This community belongs to the Jaén province and is in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He is dedicated to his lime crop and has lime farms.  He harvest and then sells these limes in the city of Chiclayo.  He has been doing this work for more than five years.  Santos also has a small corner store business that he runs out of his home, and has many good personal references.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme for 2,000 nuevos soles, which will permit him to buy fertilizer for his lime crop.  In doing this, he will earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lime crop.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 58 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Carmelita requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as snack foods, beverages and other groceries.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as snack foods, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Marela

texts.en:
Marela is 36 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Marela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000  PHP  loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marela has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with nurturing and cleaning her coffee crop.

loans.name: Las Chicualenses Group

texts.en:
Chicuá is a rural area located in the Western Highlands of Chichicastenango, Guatemala. The entire indigenous population is Mayan Kiché, and the majority of the population works in agricultural endeavors. Many of the women work in traditional textile production. Actually, entire families participate in these activities.

With the goals of strengthening and increasing their textile businesses, ten women have organized themselves into a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Chicualense”, which means “Women of Chicua”. They have welcomed two new members to the Trust Bank, and are happy to apply for a new loan that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors.

Juana is the President of the Trust Bank. She has one young son, who will be starting his formal schooling quite soon. Juana and her husband are thrilled about his anticipated entrance into primary school, and are working hard so that he has all the support that he needs, as the couple realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future. With this in mind, Juana is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she hopes will be funded by KIVA investors. She plans to use her loan to purchase thread and supplies to diversify and increase her production of traditional blouses and “perajes”, which are multipurpose woven carrying cloths used for utilitarian (carrying babies or purchases) or ceremonial purposes.

The ladies of the “Chicualense” Trust Bank are not only happy to receive funding for their loans but also to participate in the educational component of their monthly meetings. They receive practical and useful information from a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer about effective business practices including accounting, budgeting, savings and customer service. The women learn about proper hygiene, health, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”, and it is a most effective mixture.

The entire Trust Bank is most appreciative that there are people from throughout the world who learn about them and fund their loans. They are committed to using the funds wisely and paying them back fully and on time. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kind and generous gesture!

loans.use: to purchase thread and supplies to diversify and increase her production of traditional blouses and woven carrying cloths.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar vive junto a su esposo y su hija; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, ella   quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc.  Pilar  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Pilar lives with her husband and her daughter.  She works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  She has been doing this work for many years and has gained a lot of valuable experience which allows her to obtain better crops.  Her field is located in an agricultural zone, and she sells her products in all of the surrounding areas. She has many regular customers who prefer her products because of their quality and affordable prices.  She would like to invest in agricultural supplies but needs capital.  This is why she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL, which will alow her to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizers, pesticides, tools, etc.  Pilar has good payment references and is sure that she will be able to repay her debt on time.  She is also confident that she will be able to provide her family with the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizers, pesticides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista salie a comercializarlos, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus  hijos. El cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Victor has worked in agriculture for a number of years, growing beans and corn.  When he harvests his crop he goes out to sell it, and with his sales he earns income for his household expenses.  He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man who lives with his wife and children.  He is requesting a loan to be able to buy supplies for his crop such as: fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.  He does not earn enough to pay for these things, and with them he can earn more income and have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Poder De Dios Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias y lo coordina la señora María Auxiliadora de 29 años de edad y casada, se dedica a la compra-venta de productos agroindustriales como es el plátano y la papaya, este negocio lo heredó de su mamá desde hace ocho años, anterior a este tiempo le ayudaba y requiere el crédito para la compra de plátanos y papaya, de esta manera la  socia obtendrá mejores remuneraciones por su trabajo. Las otras socias son las señoras Elsa de 59 años de edad quien ofrece el servicio de comidería en su domicilio desde hace ocho años, y Georgina de 45 años de edad dedicada a la compra-venta de pan y los comercializa en Diriá, Diriomo y Niquinohomo desde hace seis años.
texts.en: This united group is made up of three members and is coordinated by Maria Auxiliadora, who is 29 years old and married.  She works buying and selling agricultural products such as bananas and papaya.  This is a  business that she inherited from her mother eight years ago, after having helped her with it in the past.  She needs a loan to buy bananas and papaya so that she can earn more income from her work.  The other members are Elsa, who is 59 and has been serving food in her home for eight years, and Georgina, who is 45 and has worked buying and selling bread in Diria, Diriomo and Niquinohomo for six years.

loans.use: to buy green bananas and papaya.

loans.name: Romelio

texts.es:
Romelio tiene 38 años de edad, vive al lado de su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos (16;13;10;7 años de edad), los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela del Distrito de Santo Tomás, su casa es de material rustico, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, debido al relieve accidentado de este distrito se puede cultivar frutales en las zonas bajas cercanas a los ríos , comercio de los mismos y ganadería, el distrito esta ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es conductor de su moto-taxi, haciendo servicio de transporte de pasajeros, en el Distrito de Santo Tomas y sus Caseríos, cuenta con clientela reconocida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para mantenimiento en general, tapizado de asientos, cambio de llantas de vehículo mototaxi y de esta manera le permitirá realizar mejor su trabajo, sin preocuparse por su vehículo y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Romelio is 38 years old.  He lives with his spouse and their four young children (16, 13, 10 and 7 years old) who are in school in the Santo Tomás district.  Their house is made of rustic materials.  Their community's population works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee.  Due to the hilly terrain of the region fruit trees can be planted in the lower zones near the rivers.  The people of this region are also involved in selling these products and livestock.  The district is located in the Cutervo province which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.

Romelio works as a moto-taxi driver.  He transports passengers in the district of Santo Tomas and its villages.  He has a loyal customer base.

He is seeking a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to perform general maintenance, reupholster the seats and change the tires on his moto-taxi.  This will allow him to perform better work without worrying about his vehicle.  He will also be able to generate greater earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: with general maintenance, reupholstery and changing the tires.

loans.name: Iris Violeta

texts.es:
Iris Violeta tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de patos y pavos en Huaca Rajada – Sipan, cuenta con clientela en los restaurants y moradores de la zona, su esposo le apoya en esta labor comprando los animales en lugares lejanos a un precio cómodo para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
Iris Violeta, 33, has a common law husband and lives in her own house with her children and husband in the Zaña district, a community close to the valley of the river Jequetepeque. Its population works in agriculture, trade and cattle raising. It is located in the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. 

She makes a living raising and selling ducks and turkeys in Huaca Rjaada - Sipan. She has clients in the restaurants and residences of the area. Her husband supports her with this work, buying the animals in distant places at a good price so that they can later sell them and offer them at a better price. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced feed to fatten the animals with.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals

loans.name: Julio Victor

texts.es:
Julio tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y 03 hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, café entre otros, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de animales menores y realiza servicios como jornalero agrícola, tiene una parcela pequeña de terreno que lo alquila para la siembra de arroz, Julio se esfuerza por la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y materiales para el mantenimiento de su corral.
texts.en:
Julio is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife and their three young children in a rustic house that they own.  They live in the district of Querocotillo, a community that is devoted to agriculture, specifically growing corn and coffee among others, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the province of Cutervo, which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  

Julio works selling small animals and also as an agricultural day laborer.  He has a small plot of land that he rents to grow rice.  Julio works hard in what he does.

He is seeking a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase pigs and materials to repair his corral.

loans.use: purchase pigs and materials to repair his corral.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 20 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juvy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Juvy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, soft drinks, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shiary

texts.en:
Shiary is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shiary has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Manuela De Los Angeles

texts.es: Manuela es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar conformado por su madre, sus dos hijos y su hermana, ella es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora desde hace 15 años siembra maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros asi como muestra la fotografía, para luego salir a comercializarlos.  Ella desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Manuela is a woman who is very responsible with her household obligations.  She lives with her family, which is made up of her mother, her two children and her sister. She is very hardworking, and has always worked with joy and enthusiasm.  She has worked in agriculture for 15 years, growing corn and beans. When her crop is ready she stores it in granaries like the one shown in the photo, and later sells it.  She would like to increase her sales, and so she came to the office of INTEGRAL to request a loan.  The loan will allow her to buy: manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and other things.  She would like the help she is reqesting because she has no other income, and in this way she will be able to continue supporting her household without limits.

loans.use: to buy: manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and other things.

loans.name: Jose Obdulio

texts.es: Jose es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Jose  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is very kind and a hardworker. He lives with his wife and children. He works very hard in his own plot where he plants corn and beans; his products are very good quality. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in grain bins, as seen in the photograph, to later go out to sell to the different markets that are close to his place of residence. 

Jose is requesting a loan from Integral in order to have the money he needs and invest in the purchase of farming supplies such as plague control, fertilizer, compost and seeds among other things that he needs for his cultivated land. He wishes to augment his sales in order to be able to perceive better profit and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy plague control, fertilizers, compost, and seeds among other things.

loans.name: Leonarda Angelica

texts.es: Leonarda vive junto a su familia conformada por su esposo y sus seis hijos  en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 30 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su cosecha ya  esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. ella tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Leonarda lives with her family, made up of her husband and six children, in their own home. She is dedicated to the cultivation of corn and beans. She has worked in agriculture for 30 years and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to obtain the best harvest. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the grain bins shown in the photograph in order to later go out to sell it. She already has many customers that prefer her for the quality, good prices, and above all the good service. 

Leonarda needs to invest, and so she is requesting a loan that allows her to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, compost, and herbicide. She has good references from her acquaintances and is very responsible. She assures that she will be able to settle her debt in the time established and at the same time trusts that it will bring her home economic security.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, compost, herbicide.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a junk shop. Anita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rozita

texts.en:
An $800.00 loan is offered to Rozita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will be buying bananas for resale. She has been involved in business since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business, because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Rozita independent because she is responsible for herself and also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Nadgie

texts.en:
Nadgie is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

Nadgie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items such as snack foods, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nadgie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 50 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Lucia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lucia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Lucia has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Lucia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marry Cris

texts.en:
Marry Cris is thirty years old and has three children.  Marry Cris is married and all three children are in school.

Marry Cris and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 9500 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Marry Cris has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Marry Cris can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 4,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help Nenita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  In the future, Nenita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 38 years old, married and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Maricar is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricar has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrellas Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna is a beautiful and peaceful small town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Estrellas del Carmen” or “Stars of Carmen”, was formed here some time ago and consists of eleven members, three of whom are new to the group. 

Julia is the 34-year-old married secretary of the group, a position that she takes quite seriously. One of her two children attends school. Julia studied to be a secretary, but unfortunately she was unable to find work, and so she decided to become a small businesswoman and opened a pizzeria. In addition, she sells snacks near several schools in San Juan. Julia wants to strengthen and expand her business and is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase wheat, corn, beans, sugar, sausages and other supplies.

Julia appreciates the “Microcredit Plus” program of Friendship Bridge that offers education as well as loans to the women. She calls it “a perfect formula to help the ladies empower themselves and leave poverty behind.” In their monthly meetings, the members of the Trust Bank participate in educational trainings presented by a Friendship Bridge loan officer and learn how to effectively manage their loans with information about accounting, business planning, budgeting and customer service. They learn how to take care of themselves and their families with knowledge about nutrition, health, and hygiene. The ladies also learn about women’s rights as well as self-esteem. 

Kiva investors are valuable partners in this effort and are much appreciated by the women. Thank you, Kiva investors for your kindness and generosity in assisting these ladies!

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn, beans, sugar, sausages and other supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 4 hijos dependientes, vive con su familia en el Caserío San Juan de Chorrillos, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frio, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de caña de azúcar, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de “aguardiente”, una bebida tradicional de la sierra norte del Perú, se procesa a base del jugo de la caña de azúcar de manera artesanal mediante una herramienta llamada trapiche, que con la ayuda de dos toros dan vueltas a esta herramienta que extrae el jugo de la caña, para posteriormente hervirlo y purificarlo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de sus herramientas de trabajo, así como para la compra de otras herramientas que le permitirán mejorar sus procesos de destilación.
texts.en: Francisco is 46 years old, lives with his partner, and has four dependent children.  He lives with his family in the hamlet of San Juan de Chorrillos, a rural zone in the district of Callayuc.  It is a community with a cold climate, and its population works in agriculture, especially growing cane sugar and raising livestock.  It is located in the province of Cutervo, which is part of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.  He works distilling "aguardiente", which is a traditional drink in the northern Peruvian mountains.  It is made in an artesanal manner from a base of sugar cane juice, using a traditional tool called a "trapiche", (which is a press).  He uses two bulls to turn the press and extract the sugar cane juice, which he later boils and purifies.  He has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa of 3500 nuevos soles to maintain his work tools and to  buy more tools, which will allow him to improve his distillation process.

loans.use: to maintain his press and to buy tools for distilling.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Edna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, fruits and other ingredients for her food business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, fruits and other ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 61 years old and married, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Patricia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Patricia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Patricia has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Patricia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 59 years old, married, and has six children.  Maria and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  Maria is taking out a housing loan amount of PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Maria has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her general store. With your help, Maria can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Cristy Rose

texts.en: Cristy Rose works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help Cristy Rose will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Cristy Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jacel

texts.en:
Jacel is 20 years old and is the youngest of three children in her family. Her mother Lila supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Jacel is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the third year of this 4-year course. Jacel is borrowing 20,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year. When she graduates, Jacel plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita is 45 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family. Estelita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Estelita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Estelita is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vera Angiely

texts.en: Vera Angiely is a single mom who owns and operates a rice farm to earn a living. For more than seven years on the farm, she has earned well to support her child and was able to sustain her business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the farm. From her earnings, she was able to put up a vegetable garden to earn additional income. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita feels the need for her roof to be repaired. She has requested a loan to purchase additional roofing materials. Rosita has taken several loans from the Cooperative and has religiously paid all her obligations in a timely manner. Savings, insurances, and loans have helped Rosita with all of her endeavors, especially to her little sari-sari store. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing and a to be constant on all her financing needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional roofing materials.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Estrella would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Susana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, shampoo, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, shampoo, chips, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Sunny

texts.en: Ma. Sunny is 55 years old, married, and has four children.  Ma. Sunny and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Ma. Sunny is taking out a housing loan amount of PHP 5,500 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been a NWTF borrower since 2013, and plans to recover through her general store. With your help, Ma. Sunny can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 50 years old, and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Elizabeth's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elizabeth has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Elizabeth is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Loudivina

texts.en: Loudivina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Loudivina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Loudivina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is 59 years old, and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Conchita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Conchita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Conchita is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elenor

texts.en: Elenor is 33 years old, and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Elenor works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elenor has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Elenor is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina, 32, is married and living with his family in a village in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has two children. For the last six years, Sina and his wife have been farming rice and fishing. Sometimes, his wife works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sina has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 33, is married with two children residing in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava. Together, they can earn about KHR 58,000 per day and can save about KHR 35,000 each day for the future needs. 

Mom is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops in order to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en: Residing in Bovel district of Battambang province, Sokunthea is 31 years old and the mother of two children. For her family, seven hectares of rice cropping and one and a half hectares of cassava planting are the main sources. She can supplement her income via her paid-working. This is the first loan for Sokunthea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she has teamed up in a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee, seed, and to buy fertilizer. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, seed, and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sanol

texts.en:
Sanol is 55 years old living with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district. Tobacco growing is the main source for her family’s income and she also works other jobs for a fee to gain more income. Having been in this business for 35 years she is able to earn about 20 USD per day.

This is the first loan for Sanol with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon, 54, lives in a rural village in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She is a married mother of nine children. Her family’s income is from raising pigs. She has been in this business for 36 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 30,000 per day for the future needs. 

Samon has been with VisionFund for five cycles and now she is leading her group to seek for a new loan. Samon, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pig feeds for her pig business. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for her pig business

loans.name: Chhunry

texts.en:
Chhunry is a 39-year-old married parent of two children living in the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. He is a rice farmer. He has been in the business for twenty years. He can earn about 50,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Chhunry with VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. This loan will enable him to extend his farmland so as to increase his rice production, thereby increasing his family’s income. He hopes to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Being as a construction worker, Nat, who is a 50-year-old man, can only make USD 3 per day to support his family. Nat is residing in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Nat has three children, and two of them are married. Nat has been a construction worker for four years now. Because it hard to find good sanitation, Nat would like to get a low interest loan form KIVA now in order to build a hygienic latrine for his house. Nat is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment, and living standard. She would like to thank for all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for his house.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. James tried his luck on doing a business, focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. James took another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give his farming income a big boost. James looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been in this business for more than five years. She earns well from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for repair. To improve the services, she took a new loan to buy accessories and maintenance for her vehicle
 In the future, Rufina hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy accessories and maintenance for her vehicle.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is driven by a passion in selling. She runs a store that primarily supports their family.  She never gets tired of tending her rice store everyday. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to restock bags of rice to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. Eugenia hopes to maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to restock bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marilie

texts.en:
Marilie is thirty six years old, married with four children, three of whom are in school.

Marilie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Marilie is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 7500 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Marilie has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Marilie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nubia Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Nubia ha sido comerciante gran parte de su vida y está empeñada a sacar su negocio de miscelánea adelante, en el negocio ofrece servicio de venta de accesorios, servicio de videojuegos, venta de minutos a celular y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de comidas fritas al frente del local aprovechando la buena ubicación que tiene en el municipio de Bello.
Es un negocio dinámico, multifacético donde prima el buen servicio y la amabilidad gracias a la buena gestión de Nubia.
Ella solicita u n préstamo para comprar un televisor y una consola de juegos, de este modo podrá reforzar la parte del servicio de videojuegos aumentando su capacidad para atender clientes que en su mayoría son jóvenes.
Es una mujer muy entusiasta y siempre está en busca de nuevas oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Nubia has been a shopkeeper much of her life and is working hard to advance her general store.  Her business offers sale of electronic accessories, video game services, and sale of cellular phone minutes.  On weekends she sells fried food in front of her store, taking advantage of its good location in the city of Bello.  This is a dynamic, multifaceted business, where good service and courtesy come first thanks to Nubia's management.

She is asking for a loan to buy a television and a video game console. In this way she can enhance the video game component of her business increasing her ability to serve customers, most of whom are young.  She is an enthusiastic woman and is always looking for new opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy a television and a video game console for her business

loans.name: Lekena's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Lekena is 32 years old and married. She has three dependent children. The main source of her family’s income is from her cassava plantation. Having been in this business for two years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 23,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 10,000 per day for her future needs. 

This is the second loan for Lekena with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her new group to seek a new loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Prey Chor district, Yoern is age 52 and widowed with two children. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 34 years, she manages to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is group loan for Yoern’s group of four females; Yoern is in her first cycle VisionFund. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Yoern wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal and general stock for resale.

loans.name: I Putu

texts.en:
I Putu lives with his wife and two school-age children who are still in junior high school and elementary school. To fulfill his family needs, he works as a farmer but he has no land to plant. So, with his skill and experience, he works on other people's land and gets paid for his services. I Putu's services satisfy his customers and, as a result, he has many customers. With the last loan, he was successful in managing the work and this brought a satisfactory result for him and for the owner of the land.

Now with the rainy season coming, I Putu has decided to borrow a new loan after he repaid all of his last loan. Still with his plans, he will use the loan to hire tractors, buy seed and fertilizer, and pay for labor. I Putu provides a quarantee for his services to the customers and he hopes the weather will support him. He has a dream to buy a plot of land from his profit and to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to hire tractors, buy seed and fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Hearty

texts.en: Hearty has been working in their own retail store for many years while her husband works as a driver to make a living. With her income from the store, she was able to repay successfully her previous loans used for the business. Planning to improve sales, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to offer. Hearty hopes to increase her revenue to improve the general lifestyle of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda's previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for direct selling. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Criselda would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Reynaldo works hard to support his family.

He has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling mangoes. Reynaldo is borrowing PHP 20,500 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to his customers.

Reynaldo has been sustaining his business activities through his past 13 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to his customers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Evangeline will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 69 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 15 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Lilia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional seed and fertilizer for her vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed and fertilizer for her vegetables

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 24 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Doris's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Doris has taken out a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Doris is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sarith’S Group

texts.en:
Sarith was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are three members-Sarith, Ul, and Sieng and they live in a village of Phnom Penh suburb.

Sarith, age 35, has been married since 1996 and has four children, three sons and one daughter. All of his children are in school. Sarith is a mason. He wants to buy a new motorbike because the old one breaks very often. 

Sarith is on the left, Ul is in the middle and Sineng is on the right.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 63 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes que viven en el Caserío Chafan una zona rural del distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frutas, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de lima, cuenta con fincas fruteras de lima, dichos productos lo vende en la ciudad de Chiclayo cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de lima y cereales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Isidro is 63 years old.  He is in a civil union and has two children who depend on him.  They live in the Chafan village in the rural zone of San Felipe.  The people of San Felipe work in agriculture, specifically growing fruits, selling fruit and raising cattle.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.

Isidro works growing limes.  He has farms where he grows his limes, which he sells in the city of Chiclayo.  He has over 20 years of experience in this field.

He is seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase manure to care for his lime and grain crops.  This will allow him to generate greater earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase manure to care for his lime and grain crops.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y su menor hija de 2 años de edad en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de diversas líneas lo que le permite ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cremas de belleza y cosméticos aprovechando las campañas que ofrecen estas líneas y de esta manera tener en stock los productos para exhibirlos en una vitrina de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 27 years old.  She lives with her spouse and her two year old daughter in a rustic home that they own.  They live in the Pucará district where the people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province, which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.

She works selling beauty products from various brands.  This allows her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She is seeking a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase beauty creams and cosmetics.  She is taking advantage of the sales offered by these brands so that she can have products in stock to display in her business.

loans.use: purchase beauty creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Socrates is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like crackers, powdered drinks, sugar, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Socrates has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Socrates has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like crackers, powdered drinks, sugar, and groceries

loans.name: Buen Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Blanca de 38 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 12, 14 y 16 años por quienes se esfuerza cada día para darle una mejor educación y que no les haga falta el alimento diario, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad, este negocio lo impulso desde hace diez años, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado obtener mayores ganancias porque ha invertido en mayor variedad de frutas además ha logrado comprar los productos al por mayor y venderlos al detalle lo que le genera un margen de ganancia más amplio, estos logros la ha motivado para seguir prestando en este institución para la compra de cosecha de mango de rosa y jocote. Las otras socias son las señoras Olga de 61 años de edad dedicada al destace de cerdo desde hace diecisiete años en su domicilio, y Miriam de 55 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos AVON y Zermat desde hace seis años a los pobladores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three hard working members, and it is led by Blanca.  Blanca is 38 years old, married and is the mother of three children ages 12, 14 and 16 for whom she fights everyday to provide them with the best education and to make sure they do not lack food.  She works buying and selling produce in the local market.  She started this business 10 years ago.  With her previous loans, she has been able to generate greater earnings because she has invested in a wider variety of fruits.  She has also been able to purchase products in bulk and sell them individually, which has generated a larger profit margin.  These achievements have motivated her to continue borrowing form this institution to purchase mango, rose and jocote harvests.

The other members of the group are Olga, who is 61 years old and has worked butchering pigs in her home for the past 17 years, and Miriam who is 55 years old and has worked selling Avon and Zermat cosmetics to the residents of her community for seven years.

loans.use: purchase mago, rose and jocote harvests.

loans.name: Laurino

texts.en:
Laurino is 45 years old and single. He owns and manages a small beauty salon and offers dresses for rent within his community. He aspires to become successful and financially stable in the future. To attain his goal, he aims to further improve his business and provide a better service to his customers. 

Having inadequate capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more gowns and polo shirts for rent and materials needed in his salon. He is hoping that he will be granted his loan request so that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase more  gowns and  polo shirts for rent and  materials needed in his salon.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Sur, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años de edad vive con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos, su hijo mayor ya es casado, la hija del medio terminó la secundaria en una escuela nocturna y se ocupa de ayudar a su madre la hija menor aún está en la escuela y es la esperanza de la familia.
María siempre se ocupó de su familia y los fines de semana lavaba ropa para ganar dinero extra y así ayudar a su pareja.
Con un poco de suerte maría encontró una oportunidad en el mundo del comercio, con un mínimo de capital compró un pequeño stock de ropa interior y así fue que comenzó su empresa familiar.
María tiene muchos sueños quisiera ver a su hija menor llegar a la universidad también sueña con tener su empresa, comprarse una casa, sus sueños nunca se acaban.
Por el momento le va bien dentro del comercio de ropa, sus hijas le ayudan y administran la mercadería, ella se encarga de la venta directa y tiene en mente ampliar su negocio para ayudar a su familia. Es por mejorar la calidad de vida de María y su familia que solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children.  Her oldest son is married, her middle daughter finished high school at night and helps her mother with her youngest daughter who is still in school and is the hope of the family.  María has always cared for her family and on the weekends she washes clothes to earn extra money and help her partner.  With a little luck, María found an opportunity as a merchant.  With a small amount of money, she purchased a small stock of underwear and started her own business.

María has many dreams.  She wants to see her younger daughter attend university.  She also hopes to have her business and purchase a house.  Her dreams will never be finished.  Now, her clothing sales business is going well.  Her daughters help her and deal with the merchandise.  She is in charge of the direct sales and hopes to expand her business to help her family.  In order to improve her quality of life, she is requesting a loan to purchase clothing at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean-cooking liquefied petroleum gas energy.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita owns a small sari-sari store in Oroquieta. The store keeps her busy and brings essential income to the family. Conchita has signed up her membership with the Cooperative and has taken several loans to provide for all of her financial needs. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional roofing materials. Conchita wants to live comfortably and having her roof repaired is the first step to do so.

loans.use: to purchase roofing materials to repair her roof.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 41 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Lucita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rosalina has been raising pigs for 9 years and earns additional income by farming sugarcane and corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yenny Marcela

texts.es:
Yenny tiene 30 años y es madre de un pequeño niño de 12. Es madre soltera y ha tenido que sortearse entre diferentes dificultades para sobrevivir.
Ella trabaja duramente todos los días, inicia sus labores desde las 4:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm Actualmente está dedicada a la confección de ropa en contratación con terceros.
Gracias a su buen trabajo y manejo de los recursos, sus clientes le han sugerido iniciar a trabajar con una línea propia, ella está muy interesada en la idea y es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios como tela, hilos, agujas, etc. Estos materiales le permitirán iniciar con su proyecto e ir independizándose económicamente.
Con el crédito cambiara sustancialmente su vida familiar y empresarial porque no solo podrá progresar como microempresaria si no que podrá brindarle a su hijo mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yenny is 30 years old and is mother to a young child 12 years of age. She is a single mother and has had to overcome various difficulties in order to survive.

She works hard everyday. She starts working at 4:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. Currently, she is making clothes with contracts through third parties.

Thanks to her good work and resource management, her customers have suggested that she start working on her own line. She is very interested in the idea and that is why she is requesting a loan to buy the necessary supplies, such as fabric, thread, needles, etc. These materials will allow her to begin her project and start becoming financially independent.

With this loan, her family and professional life will change substantially because she will not only be able to progress as a small-business owner, but she will be able to give her son a better well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making clothing.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education as well as in their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in increased profit.  The profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ludy hopes that her business will continue to exist for many more years and that she can always provide for their everyday needs.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nas

texts.en:
Nas is 57 years old and from the small village of Pursat Province in Cambodia.  She is working hard on the small farmland behind her house. Nas has four children and three of them are married. Even though her family has been involved in farming for a long time, her family income still limited.

Nas will use the her first loan from Kiva to build a pond next to her house so her family will have water for household uses. Her house is located far from a water source, so Nas is very happy with this loan and hopes that after the pond is completed, it will save her time and energy.

loans.use: to build a pond next to her home.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita accessed a PHP 25,000 loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 17,000 loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julita dreams that her youngest child will finish his education and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Annabella has been in this business for two years. Annabella earns more income from food vending and buying and selling firewood.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Annabella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jerusalemna

texts.en:
Jerusalemna is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Jerusalemna has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming corn.

Jerusalemna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Catalina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Catalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and married with two children; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of household good to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, etc.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 30 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of household good to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods, milk, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Maris

texts.en:
Maris is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 24 years old, married and has the expertise in sales. She runs a store that sells spare parts and other merchandise. Maris is full time at her store, checking and monitoring the sales and inventories.

She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any default. Now, she applied for a loan to to  restock the store motor and spare parts. Maris continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock the store with motor and spare parts

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 46-year-old married woman has been selling "tuba" (native coconut wine) with the help of her husband, who  also works as a carpenter. The couple earns well from this business and wants to buy additional stocks to sell in the town market.

She purchases additional native wine in bulk from the neighborhood and then sells it in town. She has become famous by providing good-quality native wine in her locality and earns enough to have a decent life. 

She is a responsible mother of four children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason, she requested a loan to buy additional native wine in bulk. She wishes to utilize her earned profit to improve the general living of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional native wine in bulk

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
