Benilda previously borrrowed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase calamansi scent (Panama orange), other ingredients, and bottles needed for her business. Her earnings helped Benilda with the education of her children and with their personal, house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more calamansi scent (Panama orange), other ingredients, and bottles needed for her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benilda dreams of expanding her business and opening other stalls. She hopes that her children will finish their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for calamansi scent (Panama orange), other ingredients, and bottles needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Catherine is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Catherine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Catherine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Glory Dewata Group

texts.en:
After undergoing their first loan, Ni Wayan was able to repay their loans on time. During six months of maintaining pigs, Ni Wayan enjoyed satisfactory results. After the sales, Ni Wayan used the net gain from the overall sale of the pigs for her children's education and for the family. The group hopes to continue their loans in the second period. They said thank you to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting their bussines.

Having succeeded in the previous period, the Glory Dewata Group proceeded to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 20,000,000 IDR for the group and the individual members got 2,000,000 IDR each. Because most have been able to increase their number of pigs, the current loan was used to buy food and fix the cages. Ni Wayan used the loan to buy a local sow and build new cages. She was very pleased with her efforts. She hopes to become a big pig seller in her village and all the profits will be used to improve the welfare of her family and make her dream come true.

One member couldn't attend the meeting because of illness.

loans.use: to buy a local sow and build new cages

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for seven years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her four children. The couple has to work hard, with the determination of having a better income to provide their children with a better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Emelia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With a loan of PHP 10,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Emelia hopes that she will have her own grocery store. She also dreams that her children will finish their studies.

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, products and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 24 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks. She has been raising ducks for five years.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry works hard to support her family. Jerry is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jerry has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Jerry would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Phoebe Adnel

texts.en:
Phoebe Adnel is 26 years old and she is married with two children.

Phoebe Adnel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft-drinks, rice, sugar, shampoo, and other groceries.

She has previously borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Phoebe Adnel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, rice, sugar, shampoo, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eustiquia

texts.en: Eustiquia is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house supported by her new loan, which she will use to purchase bags of cement, plywood and nails from the Cooperative. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Eustiquia has given this a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood and nails

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.es: Mirian posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Mirian es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. Mirian  tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirian has a shop where she sells products of primary necessity like rice, beans, and milk amongst other things.  Lately, she has gained a lot of clientele.  She always has what people need with products of excellent quality at accessible prices and unequaled service.  

Mirian is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She wants to feel like a winner and in order to achieve success her greatest secrets are constancy and dedication.  

She is ready to make her business grow and for this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, candies, drinks, etc.  Mirian has the confidence that with her dedication she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, candies. drinks. etc.

loans.name: Cherlizita

texts.en:
Cherlizita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of dry goods business in the Philippines.

Cherlizita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like blankets, curtains, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell.

Cherlizita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Cherlizita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods like blankets, curtains, blouses, and shorts

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Noted as one of the oldest groups that has received venture capital loans from MUK, particularly for their pig program, spurring enthusiasm and hard work of all members of the Tunas Rahayu group to improve the outcomes of their efforts and wanting to be financially independent.

The Tunas Rahayu group succeeded to pay off their loan to MUK on time. They successfully bred their pigs and sold them with a satisfying price.

Ayu Komang, as the Treasure of the group,  also earns a satisfied profit, and she saving it all for future needs. The bussines help her to increase the income of her family. She has a plan to borrow a new loan, to continue the bussines. Ayu Komang maintained three super quality pigs and they grew healthy and fat. She sold them for 3,100,000 IDR and earned a net profit of 1,750,000 IDR. 

Because the price of pork is quite high, this time the loan is focused to buy superior piglets for fattening. Ayu Komang will use the loan to buy superior quality piglets. She hopes that after 6 months raising pigs, the ideal weight is reached, the price of pork remains high and she will get a lot of profit. Ayu Komang plans to keep all of income and use it as working capital.

When the loan was disbursed, the head of the group, Ni Putu, couldn’t attend the meeting because she had a religious ceremony at the Temple. The woman who raised her hand is the Treasurer of the group.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more school materials for her youngest son

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yarn and elastic bands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition

loans.name: Nestora

texts.en:
Nestora is single and has a firewood vending business in the Philippines.

Nestora requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Nestora has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Nestora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Krismae Ann

texts.en:
Krismae Ann is 28 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Krismae Ann has a motorbike transportation business in the Philippines. Krismae Ann requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorbike.

Krismae Ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Krismae Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorbike

loans.name: Sreychou

texts.en:
Sreychou, 35 years old, is a mother of two children who lives in Batheay District in Kampong Cham Province. Sreychou has been working as a factory worker for nearly six years. Sreychou and her husband can make USD 4 a day. Because this amount of income can not meet her family’s needs, she wants to buy land to grow corn for supplementary income.

However, she can’t afford her dream land, so she would like to request a loan form HKL in the amount of USD 500.00 to buy farmland to grow corn. She strongly hope that, through this low-interest loan, she will be able to create more benefits. Finally, she would like to expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Brok's Group

texts.en:
Brok is a resident of the Dambae Domber district, located in Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and is also a mother of four dependent children. She is a hard-working mother. She is able to put all of her children in school. 

In order to earn a living for the family, Brok has been farming for about 18 years already. She does crop farming and cassava planting. On average, she can earn KHR 18,900 per day to support the family. 

Brok leads a group of two borrowers to request a total loan of KHR 2,100,000. This is the sixth cycle for her and the first cycle for the other member. 

Brok plans to use a portion of the loan to pay for land rental fees and another portion to pay for other expenses, such as, fertilizer, land plowing fees, and labor fees. She hopes that the yield will be favorable and can sell at a high price, so that she can earn a better income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land rental fees, land plowing fees, and labor fees and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en: Hermenia earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while her husband works as a security guard. For more than two years, Hermenia earns well and sustains the business. Her earnings go to her children's education costs. To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have more returns to generate additional income for the purpose of improving the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 36 years old and she is married with three children. With two children in still school, Margarita works very hard to provide for her family.

She buys and sells mahogany seeds in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell.

loans.name: Cheroline

texts.en:
Cheroline is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cheroline is 46 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Cheroline has a fish and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Cheroline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Cheroline has been in this business for 10 years. Cheroline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 45 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

Nemia has taken out and paid off three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Nemia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and married with 11 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, sugar, and groceries

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and married with five children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from farming rice and corn.

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Rosegelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosegelina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane. Rosegelina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business.

Rosegelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a marrid parent of four children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods and dressed chicken business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling fish. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase packs of frozen foods and dressed chicken for her business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her one previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio owns and operates a business planting and harvesting squash, which he sells in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for ten years and continues to increase his income from the farm. He has successfully repaid his previous loans used for buying farm inputs. H set aside a portion of his returns for his mango production business too. He took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dyrle

texts.en:
Dyrle owns and operates a variety store to earn a living. She has been successfully running this business for eight years and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also finds ways to improve her income by offering money transfers through SMART Padala.

She would like to take a new loan to purchase more grocery items to stock her store. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more grocery items, toiletries and beverages, both in quantity and variety.

In the future, Dyrle desires to improve the general living conditions of her family. She hopes that the profit from her business will continue to increase for her to be able to expand soon.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store like groceries, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help toward her family's personal, house hold, and business expenditures, including her children's schooling.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can draw strength and inspiration through fellowship and studying the Word of God.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta is 50 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Perfecta is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Perfecta has been farming rice for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Khoeun is a hard working farmer in the Batheay District, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. At the age of 45, Khoeun has two children. One of her children is in school and one is married. Her family income is about USD 3 per day.

Because the profit that she can earn from her farm does not reach her family's needs, Khoeun came up with a business idea, but she still lacks investment capital. Therefore, she would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy used machines to repair and sell. Khoeun expects that this new business will increase her income to meet the family's needs,

loans.use: to buy used machines to repair and sell

loans.name: Amorelio

texts.en: Amorelio is a businessman from Oroquieta City. He is responsible for providing all the needs of his family and the education of his children. In need of financial support for the flooring in his house, he took a loan to purchase bags of cement and tiles. Amorelio sees a comfortable life with his family around.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and tiles for flooring

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Gay requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Gay is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from fish vending and buying and selling vegetables.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. Editha is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like bread, coffee, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like bread, coffee, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To remodel his house (paint the walls and repair the roof) and buy a living and dining room suite.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 19 years old, married with one kid. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Razel has an E-Loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of prepaid load to offer for resale.

Razel has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of prepaid load to offer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for care and maintenance of her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su madre, su hermano y su cuñada, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Maria has been working in agriculture for several years which has given her the necessary skills and knowledge to attend to her crops.  She grows mainly corn and beans, and stores the grain at harvest time in sacks as shown in the photograph.   She sells it to dealers near her home and uses the profits from sales to help with household expenses.  

Maria lives in her own house with her mother, brother and sister-in-law.  The loan she is requesting is to buy farm supplies such as compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc. to improve profits and continue helping with household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: To buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Daniel Humberto

texts.es: Daniel se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, y es así como se gana la vida honradamente, con su trabajo logra solventar cualquier gasto que se le presente en su hogar, guarda sus cultivos en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para después comercializarlos. Daniel vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y sus tres  hijos, él  quiere seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo pero no tiene de suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Daniel has been working in agriculture for 15 years, growing corn and beans.  This is how he earns a decent living and covers household expenses.  He stores his grain as shown in the photograph and then sells it to dealers.

Daniel lives with his family, comprised of his common-law wife and three children.  He wants to continue with his crop activity since it is his only source of income, but he does not have sufficient capital to do so.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy the necessary supplies such as fertilizers, compost, disease control, herbicides, etc. to continue giving his family everything they need.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, composts, disease control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products and the needed ingredients for her food stall. Her loan also helped in the education of her children, while her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad, desde el año 2008, se dedica a la venta de mercancía a crédito.  Sus primero pasos en el comercio, los dio cuando una amiga comerciante,  impulsó su desempeño en esta actividad, con el fin de generar ingresos adicionales en su hogar. Por eso empezó vendiendo ropa deportiva, calzado, bolso, directamente a su clientela, ubicada muy cercana a su negocio y también son referidos que estos le suministran.  Ana también vende de contado en su punto comercial y para ello da apertura a su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.  Sus compras las realizan a mayoristas de diversas mercancías, para lograr ofrecer precios competitivos a sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local y terminar de educar profesionalmente a sus 3 hijos, que se encuentran en las edades  de 12, 16 y 17 años, con quien habita y son sus mayores inspiradores, para continuar adelante. Su mayor desafío es lograr el incremento de sus ventas, fidelizar a sus clientes y poder ahorrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, jeans, camisas, calzado, bolsos, perfumería etc. Con ello se propone incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades, mejorando así su negocio con esta nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Since 2008, Ana, who is 38 years old, has made a living selling merchandise to be paid in installments. She took her first steps in the trade when a friend in the business inspired her to perform this activity with the goal of generating additional income for her household.  For this reason she began selling sports apparel, footwear and handbags directly to her customers, who are located close to her business and are also referred to her by her customers.

Ana also sells for cash in her place of business, and in order to do so, opens her business from 8am until 6pm. She makes her purchases from various goods offered at wholesale in order to be able to offer competitive prices to her customers. Her future goal is to have a premises for her business and finish professionally educating her three children, who are 12, 16 and 17 years old, with whom she lives and who are her greatest inspiration to continue moving forward. 

Her greatest challenge is to achieve an increase in her sales, increase customer loyalty and be able to save. She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first financing the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo makes, with which she will buy jeans, shirts, footwear, handbags, perfume, etc. With the loan, she intends to increase her sales and her earnings, in this way improving her business with this new investment.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, footwear, handbags, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna  has been running a general store for more than eleven years and she earns well for the family. Her previous loans from GDMPC that she used in her general store have been successfully repaid. Her earnings goes to their daily expenditures and she had to borrow a loan to sustain and improve sales. Recently, Myrna took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for sale. She always finds ways to augment their living. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her family. Irene is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, etc.

Irene has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old and married with four children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elena has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Elena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.en:
Manuel is a farmer raising African palm trees (from which oils are extracted), age 61 years who lives with his spouse, Sandra and 4 children.   
It is clear that Manuel works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  The kerosene lamps, which must be lit by striking a match, produce substantial contamination in the house, present a risk of fire and produce a very low level of lighting. 
He mentioned that he hopes to have light when he arises very early in the morning and so that his children can have light at night.  To improve living conditions for his family, Manuel is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.  With this system the illumination in the house will be with highly efficient and long life LED lamps.  With electrical light it is much easier to study and other activities are much more pleasant, such as cooking in the kitchen or gathering the family at the dinner table or in the living room. The solar electric system can power a television and radio which provide entertainment, news and education in this rural area providing better access to information from within the country and around the world. The system can also maintain the charge in a cellular telephone to allow essential communications from this rural area.
In addition to the reduction of toxic fumes from kerosene lamps, the solar electric system reduces the family’s energy costs by eliminating the cost of kerosene, the cost of dry cell batteries for radios and the cost of cell phone charging with related cost of transport to an urban center for charging.  These savings will provide Manuel a return on his investment in the solar electric system.  The solar panel has a 25 year warranty. Soluz Honduras installs, guarantees, and maintains the system to assure that the benefits will continue for many years. 
A positive global environmental impact of this investment is the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions (0.25 tons per year) that results from the elimination of kerosene consumption.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Manolita has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from fish vending and a general store.

Manolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 71 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seveh children now at their adult age. 
Sofia is engaged in snack vending, particularly banana cue cooking, and dressmaking business for five years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of cloth and dress accessories for her tailoring business.
Sofia has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Sofia hopes to expand her dressmaking business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cloth and dress accessories.

loans.name: Ma. Grezil

texts.en: Ma. Grezil has been operating a general store selling grocery goods in the local community for years and is earning well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business and also has savings from a portion of her revenue. To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to resell. She is hopeful she will gain more profit to save more for the future of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been operating a service based business proving tricycle rental and transportation to make a living. She has been doing this for more than three years, earning enough for their basic needs. Her previous loan which was used for buying tires, was successfully repaid. 

Earlier this month, she took a loan to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In the future, she wants to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion helps her husband in their fishing business for a living.  She has been doing this for eleven years, earning well for the family, and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Her income goes to their daily expenditure and she had to move forward in order to maintain and sustain their source of income. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a very hard working entrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines. She is 47 years old and has nine children. Donato, her husband, works as a tricycle driver. She manages a variety store and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Susan is taking PHP 15,000 loan assistance to buy grocery items and other products to increase her inventory. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to continue meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children.
*As shown in the picture, Susan maintains her food vending business that help to provide income for her.

Susan hopes to grow her business as years go by. She dreams of a successful life for her children and that they will all have jobs fitted to their skills and goals. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting,* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Violenda

texts.en:
This is Violenda, 56, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Felotio and they have children. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Violenda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Violenda hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Garnet works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending, video machine rental and a computer shop. Garnet is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to  purchase more groceries like bread, soft-drinks, beer, snack food, shampoo and other groceries to sell for her general store business.

Garnet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like bread, soft-drinks, beer, snack food, shampoo and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ritchlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ritchlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Ritchlyn is borrowing PHP 50,00 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad transportation business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenny works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Jenny is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 49 years old, married and has three children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccine for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccine for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lucita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and snack foods for her food vending business.

Lucita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and snack foods for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marcelina has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Marilou has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food production.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old and married with five children. 

Julieta is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Julieta has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Reymelda

texts.en:
Reymelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Reymelda has been in this business for 15 years. Reymelda earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is from the village of Cabalaoangan Norte, Rosales, Pangasinan. She is 42 years of age and married with three children. Her source of income is through direct selling of food supplements while her husband, Jewel, is working as a seaman. It is Lourdes’ dream to have children with a college diploma. For this reason, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva for PHP 200,000 for the tuition fee of her daughter, Feby Andrea. Though she and her husband are earning, it is not enough to pay the tuition fee of their daughter in full, for she knows that college education is expensive. Feby Andrea desires to take a Bachelor of Science in Biology because this is where she excels. As a daughter, she wants her parents be proud of her. Feby Andrea sees herself as a professional someday. Thus, she is very determined to finish her college education for she believes that this will be her passage to achieve her dreams not only for herself but for her family as well.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 31 years old and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, noodles, etc.

Marifel has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from farming corn.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, and noodles

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Jose  vive junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, él  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno está en un lugar accesible, apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce  lo guarda en sacos así como muestra la fotografía y luego lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, Jose es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador, él solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and children. They live in a house of their own. Jose works growing corn and beans. He has been working in agriculture for many years and has gained a lot of experience, useful for having the best harvests. His plot is located in a good place and is very fertile. He keeps everything he harvests in bags, as the picture shows, and sells it to locals. He has now a good customer base because people know that what he sells is of high quality and his prices are affordable.

Jose is a responsible and hardworking man. He is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL to buy seeds, herbicides, compost, tools, etc. He has a good payment record. He is sure he will be able to pay off the loan and be able to give his family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicide, compost, tools, etc.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en: Verginia joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She applied for a loan to obtain additional capital for her business. She wants to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.  She envisions acquiring an additional fishing boat. She also dreams of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of their children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and consumables

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Reina Maribel

texts.es: Reina tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Reina se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza como: jabón, lejía y detergente. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo y es lo que le permite ajustar los gastos del hogar. Reina desea ampliar su negocio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor mercadería (lejía, detergente y jabón) con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y poder dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is 49 years old and lives with her life partner and her family in a house they own. Reina sells cleaning products such as soap, bleach and detergent. She has been working as a street vendor for a long time. This is how she helps to cover the home expenses.

Reina wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy wholesale products. She will buy bleach, detergent and soap with the intention to improve her sales and income, and be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bleach, detergent and soap for her business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 30 years old. He is in a relationship and has two children. They live in the Carmencita. He works in agrículture, growing vegetables and crops. He chose this vocation because his father left him some land to cultivate and diversify his production. That is where he gets the greatest part of his income, with the goal of improving his family's conditions. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds and pesticide for his crops and to diversify his production. His short-term goal is to be able to provide his family with clothing and remodel his home to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide for his crops

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en:
Rufo is 48 years old and lives in Carmencita with his wife and children. He is eager to get ahead, so for more than three years, he has been engaged in farming, renting a small plot of land in the area where he lives. With the money he earns, he can cover the cost of his home.

One of his major goals is to provide a better future and a quality education for his young son and raise him to be a good person. He is characterized as friendly, responsible, hardworking and respectful, which is why he works tirelessly so that his crops are of the highest quality. He uses materials that are not damaging to the crops or the environment.

Rufo is grateful to ASKI and Kiva lenders for the support they have given him. He can buy materials for better production and perform pest control for the entire crop, crop irrigation and payment of labor to help him till the soil. Thanks to this, he will have additional income for later to fulfill his greatest dream to "Build my own house of proper material."

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, perform pest control and crop irrigation and pay laborers to till the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh food (corn, millet, soya)

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlita is 58 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Merlita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Merlita has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vehicle repair shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her vehicle repair shop.

Nelly has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Ralisatou Group

texts.fr:
Mme RAMATOU est responsable du groupe RALISATOU. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des habits depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés  de la ville. 
Elle veut s’acheter  10douzaines d’habit et 05pièces de pagnes.
Mme veut  réinvestir  ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours agrandir l’activité et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en: Ramatou is responsible for the Ralisatou group and is doing well. She is married and  mother to three children aged between two and 11 years old, two of whom go to school. She has six dependents. Ramatou has been selling clothing for the past four years. She buys her stock at the local markets and would like to buy ten dozen outfits and five pieces of "pagne" (brightly colored fabric). She would like to reinvest her profits in her business and her ambition is still to expand her business and provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen outfits and five pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is 30 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, bath soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

Percy has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from frozen foods vending and buying and selling ready to wear.

Percy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, bath soap, shampoo, and noodles

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela has been operating her own vegetable stand for many years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her child. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income to provide their child with a better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Miguela would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell. With PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of vegetables and other items needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Miguela hopes to increase her profit from the business so she will be able to put up other sources of income.

She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy various fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Yacine, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle est une cliente fidèle du guichet et a déjà bénéficié de plus de 5 crédits sur place. Yacine s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner depuis maintenant 10 ans. Chaque jour, elle se lève à 6h du matin pour préparer les mets qu’elle va vendre. Elle a besoin d’un crédit, afin d’acheter en grande quantité les condiments dont elle aura besoin pour la préparation : oignon, poivre, ail, pomme de terre, viande, petits pois, des haricots…
Avec les recettes de son activité, elle gère ses besoins personnels, mais participe aussi à la gestion de la famille en s’occupant de la scolarité de ses enfants.
Yacine désire ouvrir un grand restaurant et vendre aussi le repas de midi et du soir.
texts.en: Our borrower is called Yacine and she is 40 years old, married and a mother. She is a loyal customer of the branch and has already had more than five loans from the branch. She has been selling breakfasts for ten years now and each day she gets up at six in the moring to prepare the dishes she is going to sell. She needs a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of condiments that she will need for her preparations: onions, pepper, garlic, potatoes, meat, peas, beans...With the income from her business she is able to manage her personal needs and also contribute to the family's outgoings by taking care of  her children's school fees. Yacine would like to open a large restaurant and sell lunches and dinners too.

loans.use: to buy condiments: onions, pepper, garlic..for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gorgui, un homme de la quarantaine, s’active dans l’embouche depuis longtemps. Son père l’emmenait avec lui pour surveiller les bêtes et les faire paitre dans les pâturages, c’est d’ailleurs là qu’il a appris et aimé le métier. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter trois veaux, qu’il va emboucher et revendre après.
Gorgui vit en famille avec sa femme et ses enfants, et ses frères ; ils se partagent les charges de la maison à tour de rôle et la dépense quotidienne.
Gorgui veut devenir un grand éleveur et avoir beaucoup de bœufs.
texts.en:
Gorgui, who is a man of around forty, has been active in animal fattening for a long time. His father used to take him with him to watch over after the animals and let them graze in the pastures, and it was there that he learnt the trade and began to like it. He is requesting this loan to buy three calves that he will fatten and sell afterwards.

Gorgui lives with his family: with his wife and his children as well as his brothers. They share, by taking it in turns, to pay the  household expenses and daily outgoings. Gorgui would like to become a significant cattle breeder and have a large quantity of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Winneda

texts.en:
Winneda is 54 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Winneda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from farming rice and corn.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Reyna Mae

texts.en:
Reyna Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Reyna Mae has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Reyna Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en: Remegia’s small business is going so well that she decided to expand in Sindangan. She has applied for PHP 20,000 to purchase inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar and oil. Remegia was able to pay her previous loan in a timely fashion, and she is a member in good standing. She has high hopes that God will bless their business, and she hopes that they will own a minimart of their own when their profits permit. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar and oil to expand her business.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 52 years old, a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Divina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Divina applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Divina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 52 years old, and three of her children are currently in school. Rosalina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina applied for a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. Rosalina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en: Paterna is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Paterna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Paterna aspires to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio is applying for a new loan to invest in rice cultivation; he will buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides. Having the basic agricultural inputs ensures the readiness of the land and a very productive crop. With the previous loan, he was able to improve the yield of his crop. He enjoyed a higher income, with which he offered his family better nourishment, clothing, and health. Furthermore, it allows him to be punctual in the payment of his dues.

loans.use: to invest in rice cultivation; he will buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Shiela May

texts.en:
Shiela May is 38 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Shiela May requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies.

She has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Shiela May would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine agreed to join Paglaum MPC so that she could take out a loan as she wanted to start up a sari-sari general store. But aside from the financial assistance she receives, Geraldine also enjoys the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock for her store, such as biscuits, milk, shampoo and noodles. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, like biscuits, milk, shampoo and noodles

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Magela

texts.en:
Magela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling clothes and bags in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more goods for her stall, like bags, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear items.

Magela successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Magela's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, like bags, school uniforms and pants.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Socorro works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from karaoke machine rentals. Socorro is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, like toothpaste, vinegar, canned goods, coffee and sugar.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like toothpaste, vinegar, canned goods, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also has found ways to boost her income, by managing a farm and also through maintaining a jeepney (public transport) business.

Cecilia would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

In the future, Cecilia wants to grow her business and to create other sources of income. She also dreams of a well-to-do life and good health for her family.

She meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, wire and baskets

loans.name: Mary Melanie

texts.en:
Mary Melanie owns and manages a small retail store within her community. She is 41 years old, married and blessed with two siblings.

She and her husband dreamed to improve their status of living in order to educate their children.  With this regard, Mary Melanie aspired to further improve her business to generate a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more stock of seasonings, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, shampoos, beverages, noodles, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell.

She is hoping that she will avail herself of a loan so she will be able to improve the business and their status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of seasonings, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, shampoos, beverages, noodles, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Merlita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elela

texts.en:
Elela is thirty-two years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Elela works very hard to provide for them.

Elela's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elela has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elela has taken a 6,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elela is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to have enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Eduvijes

texts.en:
Eduvijes is 70 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children who are now at their adult age.

Eduvijes has been engaged in a street food vending business for 5 years already and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of snacks, viand and other foods to sell.

Eduvijes has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, Eduvijes hopes to expand her street food vending business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional stock of snacks, viand and other foods

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 65 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children who are now at their adult age.

Elsa has been engaged in ice making and a retailing business for 13 years already and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in paying her insurances in our cooperative.

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for almost 14 years. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her ice making and retailing businesses.

loans.use: to be used in paying her insurances

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Aldo hoy tiene 30 años, el se dedica a la venta ambulante, vende todo tipo de productos, y con ello es que ayuda a su familia dándoles todo lo que necesita. Es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere progresar en la vida. Comenta que gracias a su préstamo anterior pudo surtirse para sus ventas, hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas, con lo cual podrá seguir luchando.
Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder crecer en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en: Also is currently 30 years old. He works selling things as a traveling salesman and sells all sorts of goods. And this is how he helps his family and gives them all that they need. He is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead in life. He comments that, thanks to his earlier loan, he was able to stock-up his business. Now he is requesting a new loan to invest in buying bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths, and sheets, with which he can keep striving. He is grateful for this new opportunity that he is receiving to be able to keep growing his micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths, and sheets.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres trabajadoras, ya que todas y cada una de ellas está trabajando duramente para poder crecer y salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Yennie es una de estas señoras, una persona muy dedicada a su familia, y que siempre busca poder crecer y mejorar para darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Se dedica a la manicura, y se considera muy buena en lo que hace,  por lo que tiene una muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y que la conozcan por todos lados en su barrio.
Yennie pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de alicates, limas, esmaltes, cortaúñas y demás, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajadoras (Hardworking Women) as each and every one of them is working hard to be able to succeed and grow. Through their efforts and continuous work and the vital actions of a successful woman, they have been getting out of poverty.
Yennie is one of these women. She is very dedicated to her family and so she always looks for ways to grow and improve herself so that she can give her family what she was not able to have. She works as a manicurist and is considered very good at what she does, so she has a good customer base. Her dream is to be able to keep growing and to be known in all parts of her neighborhood.
Yennie is requesting this loan to invest in buying nail cutters, nail files, nail polish, nail clippers, and other supplies. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy nail cutters, nail files, nail polish, nail clippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Es una señora alegre y luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 54 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: 5 adultos y un menor de edad. Desde hace 6 años estableció su negocio de ventas de postes de madera. Inicio con capital propio. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: postes de madera de pino, entre otras variedades. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en: This borrower is a cheerful and hardworking woman who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 54 years old and married with 6 children, 5 of whom are adults and 1 of whom is a minor. She started her business selling wood posts 6 years ago. She began it with her own money. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise: wooden posts made of pine and other varieties of tree. Her dream is for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: pinewood posts and types.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 10, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través de capacitaciones y trabajo en equipo van mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Modesta quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más para poder mejorar su estilo de vida, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comidas, es muy conocida en el barrio por las delicias que prepara, es por eso que le va muy bien, comenta que por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia y demás seres queridos.
