La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de verduras, frutas, panificados, lácteos, carnes etc., lo que le ayudará a poder seguir trabajando, y luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas (United Women) group is in its tenth cycle and is part of the poverty elimination program, where through trainings and teamwork they are progressing. 

One of the members is Modesta who in the latest survey showed a poverty level within level one, which means that she must strive a little harder to improve her lifestyle.  She makes a living selling and preparing food.  She is very well known in her neighborhood for the delicacies that she prepares.  It is for this reason that things are going well for her.  She says that by means of her sales she is helping her family and other loved ones. 

Modesta is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, fruits, bakery products, milk products, meats, etc., which will help her to be able to continue working and fighting to be able to improve her conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, bakery products, milk products, meats, etc.

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran tres socios exitosos en su vida laboral, y lo coordina la señora Patricia de 31 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, es propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó trece años atrás cuando le hizo un préstamo a su hermano para comenzar, y con su esfuerzo y dedicación ha aumentado el negocio y para seguir mejorando solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, dacron, entre tela, manta, botone, cinta de mantequilla, zippers, etc., esta socia es ejemplo de superación. Otra de las socias es la señora Josefa de 60 años de edad quien es propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace catorce años y el señor Henry de 29 años de edad, propietario de una mini pulpería desde hace dos años.
texts.en: This united group comprises 3 members who are successful in their work life and and coordinated by Patricia. She is 31 years old, has a partner, and is the mother of 3 children. She owns a dressmaking and sewing workshop in her home. She started this business 3 years ago when her brother gave her a loan to do so. Through much effort and dedication, she has grown her business and, in order to keep improving, she is requesting this loan to buy fabric, Dacron, interfacing, buttons, satin ribbon, zippers, etc. She is an example of someone who gets ahead. Other members are 60 year old Josefa, who also runs a dressmaking business from her home and has been doing so for 14 years, and 29 year old Henry, the proprietor of a mini-grocery store which he has been running for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, Dacron, interfacing, buttons, zippers,  entre tela, manta, botone, satin ribbon, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 34 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, menores de edad. Desde hace 4 años ha habitado en una pequeña vivienda de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y diga, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales, para construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera: madera rustica y cepillada, hierro, cemento, bloques, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su Sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: This borrower is originally from Puerto Cabezas. He is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children who are all minors. For the past 4 years, he has lived in a small wooden house. With the goal of living in a safe and dignified way, he is requesting a loan to buy materials to build a type of house that combines concrete and wood in its wall construction: rough wood, iron, cement, cinder blocks, zinc, nails and the cost of labor. His dream is to have a concrete house.

loans.use: to construct his home of concrete and wood:  rough wood, iron, cement, cinder blocks, zinc, nails, and labor costs.

loans.name: Uldarica

texts.en:
This is Uldarica, 53, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Her partner is Rodolfo and she is a mother to her child. She, together with her partner, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Uldarica operates a peanut butter making business. She buys raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, processes them, then repacks them and sells them per piece to individuals, general store owners and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She also sells rice for additional income. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of raw ingredients like peanuts, sugar, bottles, sealer and other products needed in peanut butter making.

Uldarica hopes that her business will be established and have more customers. She dreams to help her family in terms of their finances. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of raw ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es nuevo, todas ellas están en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, con mucho entusiasmo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Una de ellas es la Sra. Lucila, quien por medio de la venta de plantas y planteras está saliendo adelante y dando a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y de esa forma evitar que sus seres queridos tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Lucila es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de planteras y brotes de plantas, para que de esa forma siga con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This is a new group, and so all of these borrowers are in their first cycle of the women's program.  They are all very enthusiastic to be able to grow and move themselves forward.  

One of these members is Lucila.  Through the sale of plants and buds, she is able to move ahead and give her family everything that she was unable to have.  In this way, she is able to ensure that her loved ones are not in want of anything.

Lucila is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of plant buds and sprouts so that she may continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy plant buds and sprouts to sell.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three members: Sophea, Sina and Chre. They live in a village of the Phnom Penh suburbs.

Sophea, age 43, is a baby sitter for kindergarten. She has three children: one son and two daughters. One of her children has full-time employment, one works for a mini mart and another attends school.
 
Sophea’s daughter, who works for the mini mart, supplements her income by investing with her friends. She buys and sells cosmetics, and she wants to buy more cosmetics for resale.
 
Sophea decided to apply for a loan in order to help capitalize her daughter.
     
Sophea is on the left, Sina is in the middle and Chrep is on the right.

loans.use: To enable her daughter to buy additional cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for many years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her child. The couple have to work hard, with the outcome of having better income to provide their child with better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Ma. Victoria would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of PHP 30,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ma. Victoria hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She dreams of a better future for her only offspring so she works hard every day.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Michilou

texts.en:
Michilou has been putting aside savings for many days for their future emergencies, but most of the savings are spent on household expenses. Now she wants to buy  additional grocery goods to sell   to improve sales and revenue. 

Therefore, Michilou has requested a loan from GDMPC so that she can  buy  additional grocery goods to sell  and repair her house  using her savings. She joined GDMPC recently.

loans.use: to  buy  additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 36 years old, very friendly and a hard worker. He lives with his wife and children and works very hard on his own piece of land where he grows rice. His produce is of very good quality, and when the crop is ready, he sells it in the different markets that are near his house. He also works as a bricklayer. 

He is asking for a loan so that he will have the money he needs to invest in buying agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. to continue growing his crops and improving the land. He is anxious to increase his sales so he can earn more money and give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. to continue growing his crops and improving the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine for his health.

loans.name: Mabeth

texts.en:
Mabeth is twenty-two years old, married, and has two children.  

Mabeth and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Mabeth is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 5,500 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mabeth has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Mabeth can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 23 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Angela works very hard to provide for the family.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to sell.

Angela has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is twenty-nine years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angeline's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Angeline has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Angeline has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Angeline is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Arlene has been in pig fattening for nine years now, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Arlene requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rossini

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rossini works hard to support her family. She has a dry goods business in the Philippines. 

Rossini is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like shoes, school uniforms and pants.

Rossini has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like shoes, school uniforms, and pants.

loans.name: Servanda

texts.en:
Servanda is 55 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. Servanda works very hard to provide for them.

Servanda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Servanda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Servanda has taken a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Servanda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like bags, slippers, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing for her ready-to-wear  business.

Magdalena has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Magdalena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like bags, slippers, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
After 6 months maintaining their pigs, the Anyar Sari 1 group successfully repaid all the loan. But, this loan period they earned only a little profit because the price per pig was low but the price for feed was high. But, luckily they not have a loss. Although they did not earn a satisfactory profit, they will still continue the business until they have enough saving to use as working capital to run the business by themselves.

To continue the business and to cover the price of feed, the Anyar Sari 1 women need a new loan to use to purchase super quality piglets and feed.
Ni Wayan will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets and the rest for feed. To reduce the cost of feed, she gives the piglets a traditional feed made from banana leaves. She hopes the price will be high again and she can earn a satisfactory profit.

One member had to resign because she had to follow her husband and move to another place to work there. She was replaced by a new member after that new member had approval by the other members.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets and the rest for feed

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 30 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Wilma and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Wilma is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Wilma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Wilma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Having inadequate capital, Teresita wants to avail a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. 

She has been in this business for more than five years. Due to hardships of living, she aims to improve her business and make it profitable in order to help her husband in sustaining the necessities of their family. 

Having patience and strong determination, Teresita believes that someday she will improve the business and make it a more viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene, 35, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Charlene has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Charlene requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. Charlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
This is the Anyar Sari 2 Group. During the past six months, the group has succeeded in maintaining pigs. Ni Made is the group leader who is responsible for the group and their loan repayments. They have a field officer and are regularly visited by the vet to help the pigs grow well. Ni Made has three pigs to fatten and she is sold out. But the group is a bit disappointed because the price for pigs has been really low this month in their area. However, group members keep up their spirits to manage their businesses. Ni Made has not earned a profit recently but she continues her business with the full support of her husband.

Ni Made is requesting a loan to purchase two piglets, vitamins, and feed. The vet has suggested that she give her pigs more nutritious feed as well as vitamins. This will be the sixth loan for the Anyar Sari 2 group. All of the members can attend meetings and they hope this loan period will be better. Ni Made hopes she can earn more profit this time that she will use for savings.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins, and feed

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Ana de 54 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y cosmético AVON, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como es pantalones para damas, pantalones para caballeros, camisetas, blusas, talladores, licras, taloneras, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar su negocio y por medio de estas inversiones en su negocio ha logrado la superación de sus hijos. Las otras socias son las señoras Francisca de 28 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital, y Xiomara comerciante de ropa y cosméticos AVON y Zermat desde hace cuatro años a los pobladores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking members.  The coordinator is Ana.  She is fifty-four years old, is single, and is the mother of two older children.  She makes a living selling new clothing and Avon cosmetic products.  She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise, including pants for women and men, shirts, blouses, washboards, lycra, heel cushions, etc.  

With the previous loans, she has been able to make investments and grow her business; her sons have also improved.  The other members are Francisca and Xiomara.  Francisca is twenty-eight years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the biggest market in the capital.  Xiomara has been selling clothing and both Avon and Zermat cosmetics for four years to the local community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pants for women and men, shirts, blouses, washboards, lycra, heel cushions, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house on the land that he inherited from his father.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer lives in Zamboanga del Norte. He earns income through swine fattening to support the needs of his two children. He has been doing this for five years. For a 36-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy, except to see his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Elmer borrows from GDMPC microcredit to buy feeding supplies in order to boost his pigs. 

Elmer's plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en: Mwanaharusi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha has a tailoring business and she also operates a beauty salon. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Esha is requesting a loan to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoo, and hair conditioners. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoo, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married with five children, three of whom are in school and two who are adults. Emily lives in her own house without electricity or running water. For the past three years, she has sold firewood and charcoal to neighbors and passersby. Emily decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

Emily is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Gouwend Manegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHRISTINE est responsable du groupe GOUWEND MANEGRE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans  et le moins  âgé de03ans. 01  va  à l’école.  Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme est dolotière  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
 Mme veut s’acheter 04sacs de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo (bière de mil). 
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne toujours agrandir son activité  et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mme Christine is the responsible member of the group called Gouwend Manegre. She is in good health. Married, she is the mother of six children. The oldest is 22 and the youngest three years old. One of them goes to school. She is supporting four persons. 

Mme Christine has been making and selling dolo (millet beer) for five years. She buys her supplies in the surrounding villages. 

 She wants to buy four sacks of germinated millet for the preparation of dolo (millet beer). She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to continue to grow her activity and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of germinated millet for the preparation of dolo (millet beer)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petrolem Gas

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon is a 26-year-old married woman from Jabalia. She is a mother of three small kids; two sons and one daughter. Two years ago, Maysoon and her husband opened their own project which is a workshop for making coal and putting it in small bags. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Maysoon took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy raw materials for their coal workshop. By taking this loan, the production will increase and also the family income. 

Maysoon appears in the photo in the coal workshop

loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy raw materials for their coal workshop.

loans.name: Layidou  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LAYIDOU I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KONDJIGUILA, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec   MARIAM, 1 ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SELINGUE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called LAYIDOU I  are married women with an average age of 44  and on average 6 children, and they all live in polygamous families in  Kondjiguila, one of the villages of Selingue, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Mariam, the first person standing left to right in the photo, grows peanuts and rice. With her loan portion she intends to buy inputs and seeds and to pay for labor expenses to cultivate 1.5 hectares of land. Her produce is sold right in Selingue, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of resellers and of consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 195,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labor charges and buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Mboga Yiif Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Mboga Yiff regroupe trois femmes qui font une activité commune qui est celui de l’embouche. Cela fait trois ans qu’elles ont démarré cette activité. Elles logent le même village et leurs époux sont des camarades. Elles en sont à leur second crédit à l’IMCEC et veulent un renouvellement. Dès que l’argent est disponible, elles partent ensemble dans les marchés afin d’acheter des veaux et conservent un peu d’argent pour leur alimentation en attendant que ces derniers grandissent pour pouvoir se nourrir d’herbes.
Quand il y a un événement dans le village, elles sont sollicitées pour vendre les bœufs à terme et les bénéfices sont partagés en deux parties. L’une part dans la caisse et l’autre est divisée en 3 parties pour permettre aux membres du groupe de régler leur besoins personnels et celles de leur famille.
Comme projets futurs, elles veulent se constituer en GIE et élargir le groupe, mais aussi faire d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
The loan group “Mboga Yiff” comprises three women who have a business in common, that is, fattening livestock. The women started this business three years ago. They are living in the same village, and their husbands are friends. The women are on their second IMCEC loan and want to renew.

As soon as money is available, the women go to market together to purchase young cattle, reserving some money for feed while waiting for the cattle to grow up and eat grass. When there is an event in the village, the women are in demand to sell the cattle at the right time, and the profits are split and shared. One part goes to the savings fund, and the other part is divided into three parts enabling the group members to cover their personal needs and those of their family. For future plans, the group members want to form an EIG (economic interest group) and expand the group, as well as to work in other revenue-generating businesses.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Madame Arame est une femme  qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle habite à environ 17 km de la ville principale. Elle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Actuellement, elle vit chez  ses parents. Arame s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans l’achat et la vente de légumes comme les patates douces, les tomates, les aubergines, les choux, carottes etc..Sa  journée de travail  commence à 09 h du matin pour finir à 19 h le soir.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des légumes pour les revendre. Elle dispose d'une table devant chez elle. 
Arame aide ses parents dans la dépense quotidienne et paie aussi les frais de scolarité de son enfant.
Avec l’appui de la caisse elle voudrait augmenter son fond de roulement et diversifier ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Arame is a woman who markets fruit & vegetables. She lives about 17 km from the main city. She is divorced and the mother of one child. She currently lives with her parents. Arame has been active for over ten years buying and selling vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, tomatoes, eggplants, cabbage, carrots, etc.  Her workday begins at 9 AM and ends at 7 PM. 

With this loan, she is going to purchase some vegetables to resell. She has a table in front of her home. She helps out her parents in covering day-to-day expenses, and she also covers her child’s schooling costs. With support from the microfinance institution, she would like to increase her working capital and diversify her revenues in order to improve her small family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business.

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Aydalina de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, es propietaria de un taller de zapatería, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como es pega blanca, pega amarilla, cuero sintético, hilo, suelas, etc., con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado ampliar su taller, y darle mantenimiento a maquinaria que utiliza para la realización de producto, es con el objetivo de cubrir los gastos familiares y brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su familia que solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
Aydalina is forty-one years old.  She is married, has two children, and also runs a shoe workshop.  

She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials like white glue, yellow glue, imitation leather, thread, soles, etc.  With her previous loans, she has been able to grow her workshop and maintain the machinery that she uses to make her shoes.  With the help of this loan, she hopes to be able to cover the familial expenses and offer a better quality of life to her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like white glue, yellow glue, shoe soles, thread, imitation leather, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is runs a general store while her husband works as a teacher to make a living. Aside from this, she also manages their farm to earn extra income. For the ten years she has been running the business, she has earned enough to support the needs of her children and was able to sustain it.  

She took a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia has owned and operated a farm business for many years, planting and harvesting pineapples and other fruits for sale. She has been able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

Letecia wants to improve her farm for she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 40,000, to purchase organic fertilizer and other supplies to improve the farm.

In the future, Letecia hopes that her profits from her farming business will continue to grow so that she could add them up for capitalization and other investments. She dreams only of a better living and good health for her and her family.

She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to be used in her business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a farmer who cultivates her own land with her husband. Her goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her four children and her family. Annabelle needs to pay for school fees and also cover her household expenses.
 
Annabelle is requesting a loan to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her banana production. She is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity. Annabelle hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer for her banana production

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena runs a small grocery store. In addition, to make a living they have her husband’s income as a plumber in a private construction company. She finds ways to augment their living. She is determined to save money for the future of her children so she keeps on selling goods in the community to realize her dream. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business and was able to put up a capital to start selling cosmetic products in addition to her grocery. Recently she took a new loan to buy cosmetic products to sell in addition to her grocery goods.

She hopes to gain more income to be use for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell in addition to her grocery goods.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia helps her husband by managing her own cafeteria from which she earns well for the family. Her husband works in a private institution in which  he earns extra income which helps to pay their living costs. She also saves money which she wants to use to renovate their house but still she has not saved enough for all the expenses needed. 

Recently she took a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She joined GDMPC recently.

Florencia is hoping to get yield higher returns from her business and wants to sustain and improve it to have a stable source of income in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hard working entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 55 years old and has five children. She, together with her husband, breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures.

She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every month.

Julieta’s family is one of the affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost. Julieta is taking out PHP 30,000 loan assistance to buy additional hogs and feeds. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and other materials which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, Julieta hopes to grow her business and so her earnings. She dreams that her children will complete their studies.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is fifty one years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

Cecelia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Cecelia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Cecelia has taken a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Cecelia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is forty eight years old, married and has one child.  

Evelyn and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Evelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Evelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Evelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that she used to improve her living standards. She operates a food stall and her prior loan enabled her to expand her business and improve her income.

Mwanahamisi is requesting a loan to purchase rice, onions, cooking oil, tomatoes, beans, wheat flour, vegetables, and potatoes for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, onions, cooking oil, tomatoes, beans, wheat flour, vegetables, and potatoes

loans.name: Charlesia

texts.en:
Charlesia is 64 years old and married with two children. 

Charlesia is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Charlesia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Charlesia has been in pig-fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Charlesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a hardworking woman who operates various businesses such as firewood selling, rental houses and she also sells women's wrap clothes (lessos).

Mwanahamisi greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in all her business thus improving her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase bales of women's wrap clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of women's wrap clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a used car.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 57 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de paletas de forma ambulante desde hace 25 años. Este negocio le permite ganarse el sustento diario y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Con el deseo de mejoras sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en su negocio por lo que comprará mayor cantidad de paletas para ofrecer a un número mayor de clientes que le permita mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santiago is 57 years old and has earned his living selling popsicles as a street vendor for 25 years.  This business earns him his daily sustenance and is his main source of income.

Hoping to improve his living conditions he is asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in his business by purchasing a larger number of popsicles that he can offer to more customers to improve sales and his income.

loans.use: to invest in his popsicle sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics to resell

loans.name: El Capulin 1 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios laboriosos, lo coordina el señor Pedro de 56 años de edad, acompañado, quien se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de la localidad, este negocio lo impulsó quince años atrás por lo que con los créditos anteriores asegura que ha visto progreso en su vida personal y laboral, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate, con el objetivo de seguir aumentando sus ganancias. Los otros socios lo integran el señor Juan de 41 años de edad, dedicado a la compra-venta de frutas y verduras desde hace siete años en el mercado de Masaya, y la señora Lucila de 34 años de edad, comerciante de repuestos de bicicletas desde hace ocho años en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hard-working members and coordinated by Pedro, who is 56 years old and in a relationship. He dedicates his time to the selling of fruit in the local market. He started the business fifteen years ago. With the previous loans he states that he has seen progress in personal and work life. He is requesting the loan to buy a crop of avocados, so he can continue to increase his profits. 

The other members are Juan, 41 years old, who has been buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market for seven years, and Lucila, 34 years old, who has been selling bicycle repair parts out of her home for eight years.

loans.use: To buy a crop of avocados.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase containers of palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie runs a general store in her community, while her husband earns income from driving. She has been doing this for more than five years, earning well for the benefit of her family. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC, used for buying grocery goods, was successfully repaid. To improve sales, Angelie took a new loan to purchase canned goods, bottled products, milk and coffee for sale. She works in her store for more than eight hours a day because she wants to save money to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products, milk and coffee for sale

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: La socia Martha es una mujer exitosa en su vida laboral, de 47 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos, quienes han sido su motivación para su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de cosechas de frutas, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate, ya que esto le generará mayores márgenes de ganancias por ser un producto que se consume a diario, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha obtenido mayores ganancias que le permite cubrir parte de las necesidades familiares y otra parte reinvierte en cosechas de este modo aumenta su venta con productos que antes no tenía.
texts.en:
The member, Martha, is a successful woman in her work life. She is 47 years old, single and the mother of two children, who have been her motivation to get ahead. She works in the sale of fruit crops. She is requesting the loan to buy a crop of avocados, since this will generate greater profit margins because it is a product that is consumed every day. 

With the previous loans, the member obtained greater profits that allow her to cover part of the family necessities and to invest another part in crops. This way she increases her sales with produce she didn't used to have.

loans.use: To buy a crop of avocados.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa  sells fruits in town for a living. She has been doing this for more than ten years, earning well for her needs. Aside from this, she also has a vegetable garden where she takes care of selling fruits in the village. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fruits to sell. Recently, she took  a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her vegetable garden in order to have a greener plot of vegetables.

She wants to improve her business and plans to save her profits for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her vegetable garden.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

William hopes to have more tricycles and dreams that his family is always in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella grows and harvest rice, work that she has done since she was married. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she had to oversee her tenants as well as her crops. 

Anabella is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future,she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a semi-urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy hair cutting machines and other items. His business goal is to own a boutique and a salon within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow. 

He also operates a motorcycle transport business. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy hair cutting machines and other items.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells household items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy and convenient place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future,she will be able to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt and other items.

loans.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is 34 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Crispy is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business. Crispy has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Crispy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 4,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Flordelina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Flordelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, candies, etc. to sell.

Divina has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, candies, etc. 

Divina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, candies to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is forty years old with four children who are in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Vilma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Vilma has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vilma is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juditha is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Juditha has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Juditha requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

Juditha has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Juditha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonora has been in this business for 12 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Leonora would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is forty five years old and married.

Norma and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Norma is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,500 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Norma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Norma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en:
A villager of Koh Sotin district located in Kampong Cham province, Kimsan is 61 years old and she is a widowed mother of one child. To earn a living, she grows cassava and run a small grocery stall as the main income-generating activities. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a second-time borrower who successfully repaid her first loan. 

For this cycle, she is the leader of a group of three members. Her group request a loan of 3,800,000 KHR and Kimsan will take a portion of 1,400,000 KHR. She plans to use the loan to buy additional groceries to sell. She hopes that the loan enables her to uplift the living conditions of her family in a gradual way.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Layidou Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  LAYIDOU II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KONDJIGUILA, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide et le riz  avec MINATA SEKOU , 1èr personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SELINGUE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the group called LAYIDOU II are married women with an average age of 44 and on average 6 children, and they all live in polygamous families in Kondjiguila, one of the villages of Selingue, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth seasonal loan with the institution. 

Minata Sekou, the first person standing left to right in the photo, grows peanuts and rice. With her loan portion she intends to buy inputs and seeds and to pay for labor expenses to cultivate 1.5 hectares of land. Her produce is sold right in Selingue, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of resellers and of consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 195,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor expenses, buy inputs, and pay for seeds.

loans.name: Ramir

texts.en:
Ramir is married with four children. He operates a business renting a house and rooms to make a living. He has been running this business for ten years, and Ramir was happy to say that this helps his family a lot while he is waiting for his children to finish their studies. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to build more rooms for rent. In the future, he wants to improve their business to reach their dreams of having a better living with his family.

loans.use: to build more rooms for rent.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with three children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Lourdes has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lourdes aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Shirley will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is twenty-two years old with two children. With one child in school, Ivy works very hard to provide for them.

Ivy's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ivy has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ivy has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ivy is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 63 years old and married with seven children. 

Marcia is in the agricultural business, farming mangoes in the Philippines. Marcia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcia has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcia would like to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is twenty eight years old and married.

Mary Grace and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Mary Grace is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mary Grace has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Mary Grace can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en: Frida appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy onions, cooking oil, wheat flour, and beans for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy onions, cooking oil, wheat flour, and beans for her business

loans.name: Febie

texts.en:
Febie is sixty years old and married with three children, she works very hard to provide for them.

Febie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Febie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Febie has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Febie is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grain for her milling business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains for her milling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
Ek Phnom district of Battambang province is the home of Sambou and her family. She is a 34-year-old married woman and also a mother of four children, three of her children are currently going to school. She struggles to earn money to support the family from paddy rice farming which she has engaged in for about 15 years already. She can earn more income via fishing. The average income for the whole family is only 26,700 KHR per day. 

Sambou has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for five years already and she has completely repaid the past loan. It has enabled her to uplift the family situation in a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of two members to request a loan of 2,400,000 KHR. Sambou's portion will be 1,400,000 KHR. She plans to use the loan to buy fishing equipment to support her business. She believes that the loan will allow her to increase her income so that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment to support her business.

loans.name: Julia Elaine

texts.es: Es una señora alegre, originaria de Waspam, madre soltera de 2 hijos, mayores de edad que estudian su carrera  universitaria, la mayor estudia sociologia en una universidad del municipio de Puerto Cabezas y el menor de 20 años estudia su carrera universitaria en una universidad de Managua. Con el objetivo de construir mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: poste, clavos, madera, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y seguir ayudando a sus hijos a que culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
She's a happy woman from Waspam and the single mother of two adult children who are in college.  The oldest one studies sociology at a university in the town of Puerto Cabezas; the younger one, 20, studies at a university in Managua.

She wants to improve her wood house on stilts, so she's requesting her second loan to buy construction materials (poles, nails, wood, and metal sheeting) and cover the labor costs.

Her dream is to finish building her house and keep on helping her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and to cover the labor costs

loans.name: Poun's Group

texts.en:
Poun is residing in Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been occupied with her current business for 11 years, earning about 28,200 KHR per day. 

She is the leader of a group of three borrowers. Her group is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 KHR and Poun will take a portion of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use the loan to buy fishing equipment such as a cast-net and hooks. She strongly believes that the loan is the key for her to be able to expand her current business so that she can earn a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fishery equipment such as a cast-net and hooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft furniture for their house.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah, a mixed farmer in Kisii, has been in the farming business for 15 years now. On a small piece of land, she has been growing tea, bananas and vegetables with the help of her four children. She also keeps cows and poultry. Peninah sells products from her farm at a local market which enables her to observe and study market trends. 

Peninah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Of all the agricultural activities, she enjoys dairy farming most because income from milk comes regularly. Peninah names all animals on her farm and she already came up with a name, Nyabarati, for her new cow. Dairy farming has grown tremendously over the last couple of years. From being a cultural activity, dairy farming in Kenya has been transformed into a full-blown business venture.

With her loan, Peninah will increase her milk output to meet her ever-increasing demand. The market prices are fair and stable and she has no worries about repaying her loan on time. The major risk she is facing is an outbreak of diseases. Peninah has committed that the proceeds from the dairy cow will go to her children’s education. She has been struggling with school fees for so long and this business move is an answer that may work out that problem.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lolo Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LOLO III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BINKO, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, mil et le riz avec   MARIAMA, 1 ère personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SELINGUE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Lolo III group are married women, who average 41 years of age with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Binko, one of the villages in Selingue, Mali's third administrative region.

They collaborate with the institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of carrying out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Mariama, who is sitting on the left of the photo, grows groundnut, millet and rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs,seeds and also cover labor costs to maintain 0,5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Selingue to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers.

She expects to make an average profit of 195,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and purchase of inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Lolo I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LOLO I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BINKO, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec   MINATA DAOUDA, 1 ere personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SELINGUE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Lolo 1 group are married women, who average 34 years of age with six children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Binko, one of the villages in Selingue, Mali's third administrative region.

They collaborate with the institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of carrying out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Minata Daouda, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs,seeds and also cover labor costs to maintain 0,5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Selingue to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. 

She expects to make an average profit of 65,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and the purchase of inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Lolo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LOLO II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BINKO, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec   AWA ADAMA, 1 ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SELINGUE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Lolo II group are married women, who average 30 years of age with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Binko, one of the villages in Selingue, Mali's third administrative region.

They collaborate with the institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of carrying out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Awa Adama, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs,seeds and also cover labor costs to maintain 0,5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Selingue to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers.

She expects to make an average profit of 95,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Sareoun's Group

texts.en:
Sareoun is a resident of Koh Sotin district located in Kampong Cham province. She is a 53-year-old married woman. She is also a mother of seven children. Sareoun earns a living by planting tobacco for sale and buying tobacco for reselling. She has been engaged in this business for about ten years already. To earn extra income for the family, she also plants corn.  

She is the group leader of a group of three members. This is the first cycle for her and her group members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. They are requesting a loan of 3,600,000 KHR which makes an equal share of 1,200,000 KHR each. Sareoun plans to use the loan to buy tobacco seedlings for planting. She hopes that the loan will unlock a way for her to uplift the situation of her family.

loans.use: To buy tobacco seedlings for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is a married man. For the past three years, he has operated a shop where he sells household items. Wilberforce describes himself to be honest. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. Wilberforce also is a farmer. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Wilberforce is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, washing soap, and other items to sell as well as to purchase farm inputs. This will be his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. Wilberforce’s business goal is to own a big supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread, washing soap, as well as farm inputs

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is married with two children. To earn a living, she helps her husband manage their farm. Vergie works harvesting and selling farm products and she earns well to support her family's needs. 

Vergie is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy fertilizer and cover replanting costs. She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover replanting costs

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en:
Kimanzi is a married man with two children. For the past five years, he has been a carpenter. Kimanzi’s business is located in a good area and his primary customers are people wanting to furnish their houses. He describes himself as ambitious and determined. Kimanzi’s biggest business challenge is the high costs of products. 

Kimanzi is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional stock of carpentry materials. This will be his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Kimanzi’s business goal is to own a second workshop in town within five years.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells beverages and offers M-Pesa services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of sufficient working capital. 

Mary will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase additional stock beverages. She hopes that in the future, she is prosperous and her business is successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman. She has four children. She operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are traders. She describes her biggest business challenge as stocking her salon. 

Grace will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to expand and diversify her boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, her children will be able to finish college. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She works cooking fried potatoes to sell to neighbors and passersby. Amina also makes fresh juice, using fruit, to sell to her customers. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Amina owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food.

Amina is requesting a loan to purchase a sack of potatoes, cooking oil, and fruits for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, cooking oil, and fruits for her business

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Shiela requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shiela has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Shiela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia es una microempresaria emprendedora, de 52 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, es propietaria de un taller de bordados en su domicilio, la socia impulsó este negocio hace veinte años y asegura que lo que le ha ayudado a mantener el negocio es vender al contado, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la producción porque la materia prima la compra al por mayor, es por este motivo que requiere el crédito para la compra de aros para bordados, dacron, hilo, tela y una máquina de pedal de segunda, cuenta con la ayuda de su familia y dos trabajadores remunerados.
