texts.en: Danelia is an enterprising small business owner.  She is 52, is in a relationship, and is a mother of two.  Danelia is the proprietor of an embroidery workshop in her home.  She started this business 20 years ago and claims that what has helped her to maintain her business is accepting cash payments.  With her previous loans she was able to increase her production because she buys her materials in bulk.  This is why she needs a loan to buy embroidery hoops, polyester, thread, fabric, and a second-hand pedal sewing machine.  She is helped by her family and two paid employees.

loans.use: to buy embroidery hoops, polyester, thread, fabric, and a second-hand pedal sewing machine

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
Panambi se llama este grupo, tiene 19 integrantes, donde todas y cada una de ellas tienen la intención de ayudarse las unas a las otras y conforme ese trabajo poder salir adelante.
Beatriz es una de las integrantes, es la presidenta del grupo y también es miembro, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se destaca por su espíritu de superación. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortas que hace sobre pedido, y en lo cual le está yendo muy bien, y donde ya se ha formado una buena clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos para hacer sus tortas, como ser harina, dulces, azúcar, manteca y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena calidad en sus productos como lo viene  haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called Panambi, and it has 19 members. Each and every one of them has the intention to help the others and to get ahead through their work.

Beatriz is one of the members; she is the president and a member of the group. She is a very hardworking and ambitious person who stands out because of her spirit of self-improvement. She sells cakes upon request and her business is going very well- she already has many clients. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase the ingredients to make her cakes, such as flour, sweets, sugar, butter and other ingredients. This way, she will be able to continue offering her clients high quality products as she has before.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sweets, sugar, butter and other items to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es: La señora María Petrona es una mujer laboriosa de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de cinco hijos de los cuales dos dependen de ellas, se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y verduras en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace dos años y le ha ido muy bien, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, posta de cerdo, costilla de cerdo, papas, cebollas, chiltomas, achote, flete de leña, quintal de maíz, etc., esta socia tiene veintidós ciclo de estar trabajando en esta institución y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
María Petrona is a hardworking 41-year-old woman.  She is married and has five children, although only two of her children are still dependent on her.  She makes a living selling Nicaraguan tamales and vegetables out of her home.  She started this business two years ago and it is going very well.  

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of rice, pork, ribs, potatoes, onions, peppers, achiote, firewood, corn, etc.  

She has been working with this institution for twenty-two loan cycles.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy rice, pork, ribs, potatoes, onions, peppers, achiote, firewood, corn, etc.

loans.name: Mariben

texts.en:
Aside from her retail store, Mariben has a farm, her family's main source of income. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. 

She has taken out a new loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer. With this loan, she plans to improve the farm to produce plenty of harvest. 

She hopes to improve her business and be able to provide for the needs of her children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Heth's Group

texts.en:
Heth is residing in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 32-year-old farmer who plants cassava to sell to earn a living. As a mother of two dependent children, Heth has been occupied in the agribusiness for about 10 years already. The average income for the whole family is only 31,800 KHR per day. 

She leads a group of two members to request a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The total loan amount is 2,800,000 KHR, which will be divided into equal shares for Heth and her partner of 1,400,000 KHR each. Heth will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and cassava trees to plant. She strongly believes that the loan will enable her to earn a better income to support the family and put her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava trees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Thelma is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her Nipa roofing business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own effortsand  with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her Nipa roofing business

loans.name: Ry Group

texts.en:
Ry is 48 years old. She is a married woman with six children in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Ry is the leader of this borrower group. 

She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Ry hopes that she can build a new house and her children can get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Touch Group

texts.en: Touch is 44 years old. He is a married man with four children in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. He and his wife are farmers. Touch is the leader of this borrower group. He will use his portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help his family live in better conditions. In the future, Touch hopes that he can purchase land for planting fruits and renovate his house. He would also like to see his children earn their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Rem Group

texts.en: Rem is 41 years old. She is a married woman with two children in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Rem is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Rem hopes that she can build a new house and her children can get a higher education.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Gnetaga Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  GNETAGA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SELEFOUGOU, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.  
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est arachide et riz   avec  SETOU , première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de SELINGUE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group GNETAGA II are married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in SELEFOUGOU, a village in KANGABA  (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are peanuts and rice, as is the case with Ms. SETOU, who is sitting first at the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers in SELINGUE. She plans on making an average profit of 195,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor quien cuenta con una pequeña panadería la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y le permite mantener la economía del hogar. Guillermo desea invertir en su negocio de panadería para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de insumos como: harina, azúcar, colorantes, canela, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que desea mejorar sus ventas así como sus ingresos.
texts.en: Guillermo is 47 and lives in his own house with his wife.  A hardworking and enterprising man, he owns a small bakery which is his main source of income and allows him to support his household.  Guillermo wants to invest in his bakery business so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to spend on supplies such as flour, sugar, food coloring, cinnamon, etc.  He hopes to receive this loan because he wants to improve his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, food coloring, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Cụm 18 Thôn Tân Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Trọng is 59 years old and she is married with three children. Trọng lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Trọng has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil, peanuts, etc.) to resell.

In 2012, Trọng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Trọng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Trọng is the group leader of the Nhóm 08 cụm 18 thôn Tân Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In the future, Trọng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food (salt, cooking-oil, peanuts, etc.) to resell

loans.name: 04 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh has a retail business selling general food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sweet, cake, salt, and similar items to resell.

Linh is 32 years old and she is married with two children. Linh is the group leader of the 04 Điện Biên Group solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Linh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Linh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Linh has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Linh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Linh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet, cake, salt, and similar items to resell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 30-year-old widow. She has three children, aged three to 15 years old. She describes herself as being determined. 

Caroline operates a food stall, where she sells tomatoes, onions, cabbage and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are local citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge as theft. 

This is Caroline's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of vegetables.

Her business goal is to own her own grocery store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables

loans.name: Nhóm 4 Thôn 6 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tự works in agriculture raising poultrys. She request a loan to purchase baby poultrys to raise and sell in the future.

Tự has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

Tự is 49 years old and she is married with one child. She lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tự joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tự has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 4 Thôn 6 Quảng Đại Group solidarity group. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

With her business profit, Tự hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultrys to raise and sell infuture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fee and buy a new computer

loans.name: Mary Rosaly

texts.en:
Mary Rosaly is a hardworking entrepreneur from Taguig Manila, Philippines. She is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Arnulfo, her husband, works to support her in business. She manages a variety store and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Mary Rosaly is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she desires to manage a bigger store. She hopes that her family will always be healthy and in good hands.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Michael Edrick is 16 years old and is second of the three children in the family. His mother, Marianita, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Michael Edrick is studying for the Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the first year of this 4-year course. Marianita is borrowing 15,000 PHP to pay her son's tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When he graduates, he plans to help his family and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Kaleta

texts.en:
Kaleta is 38 years old; she is a married woman with four children. She owns and operates a small store selling daily items such as sugar, slat, chicken legs, soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for four years. 

Kaleta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, boxes of chicken, bags of sugar, a new freezer, etc. 

She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.



(Please confirm that this is a woman)

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, boxes of chicken legs, sugar, a freezer, etc

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
BALIMAYA est un groupe de l’association KANKELE de  Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première  personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’habillements : pagne et balle de friperie. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, qui est un membre du groupe très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 pagnes et 1 balle de friperie.  Elle  s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place et vend ses habits à OUELESSEBOUGOU, au comptant, à crédit à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
BALIMAYA is a group from the association KANKELE de Ouelessebougou. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 34 years of age. Married with an average of four children each, they run different businesses, such as buying and selling clothing, as does MARIAM, who is the first person sitting at the right in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. And they have had small-scale businesses for several years and are much in demand for their trade in clothing: ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and used clothing.

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. 

MARIAM, a member of the group, is well-known in OUELESSEBOUGOU and excels at selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth and a bale of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies in BAMAKO and locally, and she sells her clothing to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit in OUELESSEBOUGOU.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA  that will enable her to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in her business buying and selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Née en  1980 à FANA, KADIATOU vit avec ses 5 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à FILABOUGOU, dans la commune rurale de  OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI, (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
KADIATOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce de condiments. KADIATOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce de condiments : poivre, choux, carotte, oignon et tomate.    
Après avoir remboursé le premier  prêt individuel, KADIATOU est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  10 panier de tomate et une quantité importante de choux, carotte et poivre. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place,  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
KADIATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in FANA, KADIATOU lives with her five children and husband in a nuclear family in FILABOUGOU, in Commune Rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI, (Région de Koulikoro) Republic of Mali. KADIATOU did not have the chance to advance in school. She soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses along side her older sister, who used to do commerce in condiments. After years of experience with her, KADIATOU opted for the same work, namely commerce in condiments:  black pepper, cabbage, carrots, onions, and tomatoes. 

After having paid back the first individual loan, KADIATOU is now on her second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso that she will use to purchase 10 baskets of tomatoes and a significant amount of cabbage, carrots, and black pepper. She gets her supplies in BAMAKO and locally. And she makes her sales at the retail level to men and women customers paying with cash or credit at her home and at the surrounding fairs. 

KADIATOU hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to help out her husband in meeting family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in her business buying and selling condiments.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is a 59-year-old mother who was gifted with four children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to financial insufficiency, Rufina has been engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables to help her husband generate income. She aims to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she wants to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more mangoes, bananas, eggplants, cabbages, onions, tomatoes and leafy vegetables to sell. She hopes that she will to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, bananas, eggplants, cabbages, onions, tomatoes and leafy vegetables to sell

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Mariano es agricultor y cultiva tomates y pepinos desde hace 5 años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en sus cultivos en la compra de los insumos como: abonos, semilla, insecticidas, etc. Espera poder mejorar su producción y así aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Mariano is 46 years old and lives in his own house together with his life partner. Mariano is a farmer who has grown tomatoes and cucumbers for 5 years. In this way, he makes a living and supports his household. With the desire of improving his income, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying supplies such as soil additives, seeds, insecticides, etc. He hopes to be able to improve his production and thus increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy soil additives, seeds, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Né en 1994 à FALAN, YAYA vit dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
YAYA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des marchandises de boutique : thé, sucre, huile, savon, biscuit, cahier, bic et boisson.     
YAYA est à son deuxième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  3 sacs de sucre,  4 cartons de savon, 20 cartons de thé, 10 cartons de savon, 10 cartons de biscuit et 1 bidon d’huile. Il  s’approvisionne auprès des  grossistes à BAMAKO  et effectue ses ventes à OUELESSEBOUGOU, au comptant, à crédit et en détail ; à une clientèle composé d’hommes et de femmes. 
YAYA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente des marchandises de boutique.
texts.en:
Born in 1994 in FALAN, YAYA lives in a nuclear family in Commune Rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, in  Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of Mali. He did not have the chance to advance in school. He soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of shop goods:  tea, sugar, oil, soap, cookies, notebooks, ballpoint pens, and drinks.  

YAYA is on his second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 3 sacks of sugar, 4 boxes of soap, 20 boxes of tea, 10 boxes of [soap], 10 boxes of cookies, and a container of oil. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in BAMAKO. And he makes his sales at the retail level to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in OUELESSEBOUGOU. 

YAYA hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and reinvest the rest in his business buying and selling shop goods.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for getting around.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Eduardo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 33 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his five children. He has made his living in agriculture for many years. His main crops are corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photo, so that he can later sell it in the various markets that are near his house.

Eduardo is applying for a loan to buy agricultural inputs like: fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc., in order to be able to continue with his crops and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky has been running a cafeteria for more than two years, earning well to contribute more for their daily expenditures. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for his business. 

To improve sales, he took a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food for sale. 

Education of his children is the highest priority on his part, and he is determined to have them be successful.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food for sale.

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia has been operating her own rental-housing business for more than eight years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. Sergia and her husband have to work hard, with the determination of having more income than they currently have, so they could provide their children with better education.

To improve her profit, Sergia would like to apply for a new loan, for the maintenance of the boarding house. An amount of PHP 25,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use the loan to add up to the capital needed for her canteen business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Sergia hopes that they could attract more boarders. She also desires to start up other business, for their additional income.

Sergia meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to renovate and beautify her boarding house, and improve her canteen business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of cereals to sell

loans.name: Carlos Horacio

texts.es:
Carlos Horacio se caracteriza por brindar una atención personalizada en su taller de mecánica. El cliente que llega a su local sale satisfecho por la calidad del servicio que ofrece. Desde niño siempre jugó con automóviles de juguetes, los cuales armaba y desarmaba con una habilidad asombrosa. Eso dio a pauta a que estableciera  su propio  negocio. 
Ya cuenta con treinta años de experiencia, lo  que le ha permitido gozar de una excelente reputación de mecánico automotriz.  Carlos Horacio piensa ampliar su local y continuar brindando un excelente servicio. Por lo tanto, decidió recurrir a otro financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito,  con el fin de conseguir más capital y poder comprar  herramientas de trabajos, repuestos, pinturas, lubricantes y aceites.
texts.en:
Carlos Horacio is known for providing personalized customer service at his mechanic shop. Customers who arrive at his shop leave satisified with the quality of service that he offers. He always played with cars as toys when he was a child, and he had an amazing ability for putting them together and taking them apart. This guided him to establish his own business.

He now has thirty years of experience, which has allowed him to enjoy an excellent reputation as a car mechanic. Carlos Horacio intends to expand his shop and continue providing an excellent service. He has therefore decided to ask KIVA MiCrédito for another loan in order to get more capital and to be able to buy tools for work, replacement parts, paints, lubricants and oils.

loans.use: to buy tools for work, replacement parts, paints, lubricants and oils.

loans.name: Seanghoun's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham province, Seanghoun is a 44-year-old widow and mother of one child. She struggles to earn a living by weaving cotton scarves. These are called “Krama.” She has been weaving and selling Krama for more than 20 years, already. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. These businesses earn her about 25,000 KHR per day.

She leads a group of three members to request a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and this is the first loan cycle for all of them. Seanghoun applies for 1,200,000 KHR as her loan portion, and the total loan for the entire group is 4,200,000 KHR. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy thread, and to pay wages to a laborer who assists her to dye the Krama. She strongly hopes that she can gain a good income, better than before the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving, and to pay the laborer who helps her to dye the scarves

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Los Ángeles Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, lo coordina la señora Ángeles de 58 años de edad y viuda, se dedica al alquiler de sillas, manteles, y mesas, este negocio lo impulsó hace veinte años de la pensión y los ingresos que percibía por la elaboración de piñatas, es primer crédito que solicita la socia en esta institución y se ha propuesto el aumento del negocio para esto requiere el crédito para invertirlo en compra de sillas y mesas. Las otras socias son las señoras Guadalupe de 61 años de edad, comerciante de ropa de segunda en su domicilio y de manera ambulante, este negocio lo tiene desde hace doce años, y María Mercedes de 21 años de edad, dedicada al destace de cerdo y derivados en su domicilio desde hace tres años. Estas socias aseguran que con este crédito podrán superare pues invertirán en sus negocios lo que será provechoso para ellas.
texts.en: The solidarity group is composed of three members with successful careers.  Ángeles is the coordinator.  She is 58 and is a widow.  Ángeles's business is renting chairs, tablecloths, and tables.  She began the business 20 years ago with her pension and income she earned from making piñatas.  This is the first loan she has requested from this institution and she plans to grow her business.  To do this, she needs a loan to spend on chairs and tables.  The other members of the group are Guadalupe, who is 61 and has been selling second-hand clothing at her home and as a mobile vendor for 12 years, and María Mercedes, who is 21 and has been butchering pigs and making pork derivatives at her home for three years.  The members are sure that with this loan they will be able to better themselves since they will spend it on what will be profitable for them in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en:
At the age of 44 years old, Sovanna is a very good primary teacher at Batheay Primary School in Batheay District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Sovanna has two children who are in school now. With her husband, the daily profit for her household is USD 3 a day. So far, it has been about ten years for Sovanna being a teacher.

Currently, Sovanna would like to request a loan from Kiva to build a fence around her house to ensure high security for her property. Sovanna thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran tres socias, y lo coordina la señora Johana es una mujer exitosa en su vida laboral de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 5 años a cargo quien es su motivación para lograr superarse y ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida; se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva y comida en su domicilio y de manera ambulante con diez años de experiencia en estos negocios, la socia ha aprovechado los créditos que se le han otorgado porque ha invertido en sus negocios provocando un aumento de sus clientelas y por ende de sus ingresos lo que le ha permitido brindarle mejores oportunidades de educación y alimentación a su hijo, por tal razón solicita el crédito para la compra de pacas de camisas, shorts y pantalón, también comprará granos básicos como es el arroz, frijol, aceite, pastas, plátanos verdes y maduros, sal, cebolla, chiltoma, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Blanca de 57 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace ocho años, y Flor de 26 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos, este negocio lo impulso cuando tenía veinte años.
texts.en:
There are three members in this solidarity group, which is coordinated by Johana. Johana is a 44-year-old woman who has been successful in her professional life. She is married and the mother of a five-year-old son in her care who is her motivation to overcome obstacles and who she wants to offer better living conditions. She makes a living by selling new clothing and food in her home and in an itinerant fashion. She has ten years of experience with these businesses.

She has taken advantage of the loans she's been given by investing in her businesses, increasing the number of her customers and thus her earnings. This has enabled her to provide her son with better opportunities for education and food. For this reason she is asking for the loan to buy packs of shirts, shorts and pants. She will also buy basic grains like rice, beans, oil, pasta, green and ripened plantains, salt, onion, peppers, etc. 

The other members are Blanca, who is 57 years old and has been the owner of a small grocery store for the last eight years, and Flor, who is 26 years old and sells cosmetics; she started this business when she was twenty years old.

loans.use: to buy packs of shirts, shorts and pants, as well as basic grains like rice, beans, oil, pasta, green and ripened plantains, salt, onion, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more trees for firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of milk.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 33-year-old woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be disciplined, focused, and determined. She operates a restaurant where she cooks rice, beans, ugali, mandazi and other foods. Her business is located in a busy commuter area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be market inflation. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase additional stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to own a bigger restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own her own premises. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a chainsaw rental business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase gasoline and tools for her business. NWTF is relisting Valerie's business profile, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and tools for her chainsaw-rental business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another egg incubator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, tools, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meet and sausages at wholesale

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y honrada, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y pan francés y sale a venderlo por las colonias donde ella reside solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in a house they own. She is a very responsible, hardworking and honest person. She works in her own bakery where she makes sweet bread and French bread, and she goes out to sell it in the neighborhoods where she lives. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in buying flour, butter, cans and everything she needs to be able to produce more. This project to improve her bakery is very important for her, as she will improve her quality of life and that of her family in this way.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, cans and everything she needs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth helps her husband to manage their vegetable garden for a living. For more than six years, this has been their only way to earn an income. She earns well enough from this business that she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. That loan was used for farm inputs. To sustain the farm, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She is hoping to gain more returns from her farm so she can save a portion of it for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a single man. He describes himself to be focused, disciplined, and business minded. He operates a retail business where he sells blankets and bed sheets. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are commuters and market goers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather conditions. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of blankets and bed sheets. His business goal is to own his own shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy his own plot of land. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of blankets and bed sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labour to look after her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dou's Group

texts.en: Dou is a resident of Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two dependent children. One of her children is too young for schooling and one is in school. The primary sources of her income come from her cassava plantation and her paid-working job. The current business earns her about 31,900 KHR. She is a leader of a group consisting of three members. This is the second cycle for her with a successful repayment of the original loan and the first cycle for the other two members. The group requests a loan of 3,600,000 KHR of which Dou receives 1,600,000 KHR. Dou plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer to use on her cassava plantation. She believes that the loan will allow her to get a higher yield from the cassava farm and earn more income to better support her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to use on her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad posee un negocio ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia donde vende adornos y recuerdos para bodas, 15 años, bautizos, etc. posee mucha clientela que la buscan porque su producto es realizado con materiales de muy buena calidad y aprecios accesibles, Maria vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and has a business in the market near her home where she sells decorations and favours for weddings, 15th birthdays, baptisms etc. She has a lot of customers who come to her because her products are made with good quality materials and her prices are affordable.

Maria lives in her own house with her three children. She is asking for a loan to buy more products wholesale so she can continue with her sales, since this is her only source of income. This will enable her to give her children a better quality of life with no restrictions.

loans.use: to buy decorations and favours for weddings, 15th birthdays, baptisms etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es: Maria de 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas fruta y verduras por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y poderle dar a su familia una menor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and for the last 10 years she has made a living selling fruit and vegetables. Her business is located in the market near her home. She is able to cover some of her household expenses with the money she makes from her sales.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale so she can continue with her sales and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused and determined. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked maize, beans, ugali, mandazi and other foods. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are schoolchildren, commuters and local workers. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to purchase additional stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to own a larger restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own her own premises.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells

loans.name: Gloria Raquel

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona emprendedora, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive en La Tinguiña junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en una Tienda Comercial, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy entusiasta, responsable y utiliza tácticas de venta que ayudan a que el negocio tenga más ganancias. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Gloria está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cama así como un televisor para que pueda sentir mayor comodidad en su hogar y pueda disfrutar de sus momentos libres. Con esto seguirá esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño: "Estudiar una carrera profesional"
texts.en:
Gloria is an enterprising person. She is 30 years old, is single and lives with her family in La Tinguiña.  For more than 2 years she has made a living selling clothing in a department store. It is going well for her because she is very enthusiastic and responsible and uses sales tactics which help the shop to make more profits. She has a great desire to make progress in life and this is why she puts a lot of effort and dedication into her work to improve her quality of life.

Gloria is grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support they have given her will enable her to buy a bed and a television so that she can feel more comfortable in her home and enjoy her free time. With this she will continue to work hard to fulfil her dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a bed and a television.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 45 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Emma has a business selling accessories in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of accessories to sell to her customers.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years. Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of accessories to sell

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en: Sarorn is living in Ek Phnom district which is located in Battambang province. She is a 44-year-old farmer. Sarorn is divorced and has a child who is dependent on her. She has engaged in a crop farming agribusiness for about 15 years already. It has been the primary source of income of her family. This is the third loan cycle for Sarorn from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has repaid the past loan completely and it has allowed her to improve the living condition of her family. Now, she leads a group of two members to request a loan of 2,800,000 KHR which will be divided in equal shares of 1,400,000 KHR each. Sarorn plans to use the loan to buy crop seeds and fertilizer and to pay a land plowing fee. She strongly believes that the loan will allow her to earn a higher income so that she can uplift her family’s situation at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds and fertilizer and to pay a land plowing fee.

loans.name: Momanyi

texts.en:
Dairy farming is a very important part of life for most small-scale farmers throughout Kenya. They produce milk, which provides nutrition for their family plus regular income-generation. In the deep rural homes in Kisii where Mr. Momanyi (pictured) comes from, dairy cows are kept for subsistence. However, Mr. Momanyi sees a great business potential in dairy.
 
Momanyi lives on a small piece of land together with his wife and child. For the last eight years, he has been earning an income through selling eggs, tea and other crops that come from his farm. He is also involved in other personal business for extra money.

Momanyi is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. With your financing, the dairy cow will enable Momanyi to increase milk production on his farm. This could also make him a model farmer who other farmers in the area could learn from. An improved quality dairy animal has specific benefits to the rural poor such as increased productivity, household food security and income. The additional income from this asset will go to his child’s education.

“Education is the foundation of having improved living standard in the future,” he said.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 41 years old and married with four children.  Two of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Anabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam is a resident from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 55-year-old widow and a mother of two children. Nam struggles to earn a living from crop farming, which she has done for about 37 years already. She also raises pigs for sale in order to generate extra income to support the family. The average income for her family is only 30,600 KHR per day. 

Nam is the leader of a group of two members and this is the first time for them to request a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. They applied for a loan of 800,000 KHR (400,000 KHR each). As a group leader, Nam plans to use the loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to use on her farm. She believes that the loan enables her to expand her current agribusiness so that she can get a greater yield from the farm.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to use on her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yoshada

texts.en:
Yoshada is 40 years old. She is married and has four children who are 20, 18, 10 and  8 years old.  Many years ago, she established her grocery business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Yoshada plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area for business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial difficulties. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of shoes. Her business goal is to become a large footwear stockist within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of shoes.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. She operates a market stall where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial difficulties. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to to own a store within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a van in order to be able to deliver bananas to customers. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bananas.

loans.name: Fanish

texts.en: Fanish is a married woman. She has 2 children, who are 2 years and 4 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a tailoring business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are individuals and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial difficulties. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a large dressmaking school within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more meats, vegetables and spices for her food stall

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef meat needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to pay for additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef meat needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Corazon hopes to have more customers and dreams to always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been operating her buy and sell business of herbal products for more than five years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. The couple has to work hard with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Elizabeth would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. At an amount of PHP 15,000, she could purchase more quantities of herbal products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes that she will be able to help more people through her business. She also dreams of meeting more individuals who will enlighten and help her to become successful in this field that she is pursuing.

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal supplies and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Adelaida would like to apply for a new loan of 40,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida hopes that her business will continue to thrive, and dreams of having a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Tawakaal Credit & Savings Group

texts.en: Ceaser is a 56-year-old man and a member of Tawakaal Credit and Savings Group. He deals in retail and farming and he faces the challenge of price fluctuation of commodities. However, he hopes to improve the livelihood of his family. Ceaser needs a loan to buy rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Chidodo

texts.en:
This is Chidodo. She previously accessed a loan that she used in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, rice and beans for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Loice. She is a mother of five who practices mixed farming in a rain-fed region of Kisii, Kenya. She sells products from her farm including milk, eggs, tea, banana and vegetables in the local market. She has been doing this for seven years. She is also engaged in small seasonal businesses to make extra money.

Loice is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She favors dairy farming because of the regular income generation. The additional cow will boost her milk output. The milk prices are consistent and the market is ready. However, the biggest challenges she faces are poor roads and lack of market for other farm produce since everyone is involved in farming.

Loice will use the additional income to take care of her children’s education. Her future dream is to provide her children will everything necessary to help them lead a much improved lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat flour, milk, tea leaves, soap, eggs, maize flour and sugar for her business. Catherine is grateful for your financial support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk, tea leaves, soap, eggs, maize flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with six children, four of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rose has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past four years, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. 

Rose is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for her business.

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan was also used to educate her child. Her income helps to pay for everyday household expenditures. She continues to work hard to provide for her family's needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 55,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to meet her family’s daily needs and education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness. 

Annalisa hopes to have more customers and dreams to have better living conditions. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Anju is 35 years old .  She is married and has an 18 year old child.  

Many years ago, she established  a business to raise cows.  She works 7 days a week, 4 hours a day to support her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and will use this recent loan to buy a cow.  In the future, Anju plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are raised for their milk to make curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer).  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for $0.50 USD. 

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, fuel for fires, and methane which can be stored in tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Swastika

texts.en:
Swastika is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 8 and 6. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Swastika plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel used the previous loan to buy phones to sell. His main business is selling phones and phone accessories. It is a very lucrative business. 

Inadequate capital and fluctuating prices affect his business growth. He desire to become a leading distributor for a telecom company. Samuel intends to use the loan to buy more phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell.

loans.name: Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane Group

texts.en: Joseph is a 24-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with two children who are four and one years old. He has been dealing in motorcycle transport since 2012 alongside farming to get income to support his family. He hopes to buy a plot and build a commercial house though he lacks enough capital.  Joseph intends to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. He is a member of Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy appreciates her previous loan that helped improve her living standards. It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Dorothy is requesting a new loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, and ceramic flooring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a married woman with one child who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan de 61 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes  mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive en casa propia casa propia con su grupo familiar, Don Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 61-years old and has made his living, for the past 30 years, in agriculture.  His main agricultural work is planting corn and beans.  He sells his products in the different markets near his home.  He lives in his own home with this family.  Don Juan is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the above photograph.  This will allow him to continue with his planting and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is studying Associate in Computer Technology at a university and wants to improve her family's living situation in the future. Her father earns an income from his services as a driver and it is spent on the family's daily expenditures. It is not easy to send the children to school as they have a big family of 3 siblings. 

Roselyn is determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job and to help her parents when they get old. She has joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy school supplies and a uniform. She is very thankful to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and a uniform

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo's wife works as an agent for a private insurance company while he has a business buying and selling varieties of fish for household aquariums. He is newly engaged in this line of business. Edgardo has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for buying additional varieties of fingerlings. He has taken a new loan to cover the costs for maintenance and the purchase of tires and spare parts for his motorcycle used in transporting his products. Edgardo is hopeful that, through this business, he could combine the business of having fish in aquariums for decoration and for business. In the future, he plans to repair his house using the returns from his investments.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, tires and spare parts

loans.name: Dayci Luz

texts.es:
Dayci es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un negocio independiente que ella maneja, a pesar de ser muy joven se ha convertido en una próspera empresaria. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está sacando adelante a su familia.
Dayci está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio y tener más ingresos que más adelante podrá utilizarlos para poder formar su negocio, constituir su empresa y colocar varias sucursales a nivel de Lima, con esto seguirá apoyando a su familia y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dayci is a young entrepreneur. She is 20 years old and single and lives with her family in the district of San Juan de Lurigancho. For almost 4 years she has made a living selling clothing in an independent business which she manages. In spite of being very young she has become a successful businesswoman. Through a great deal of effort and dedication she is helping her family to get on in life. 

Dayci is grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support they have given her will enable her to buy merchandise to stock the business and make more income. In the future she will be able to use this to set up her own business and open various branches around Lima. By doing this she will be able to continue supporting her family and will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 35-year-old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in transport and also has a farming business. Wilson's main business challenges are limited capital, weather changes and bad roads that cause constant mechanical breakdowns. However, he has a vision of educating all of his children to higher levels of learning and buying another motorcycle. Wilson needs a loan to buy land for building.

loans.use: to buy land for building.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Friah Lynn is 20 years old and she is the only child in the family. Her mother, Marilyn, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines. Friah Lynn is studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration-Management and is currently in her final year of this 4-year course. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay for Friah Lynn's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015. Friah Lynn plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 27 and 25. Many years ago, she established her grocery business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Ganga plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 17. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Sabitri plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es: Blanca de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura, siembra maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Blanca está solicitando crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación
texts.en: Blanca is 48-years old and lives in her own home with her three children.  She has made her living, for 25 years, in agriculture.  She plants corn.  With what she learns from her sales, she is able to meet the expenses that her household generates.  Blanca is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control herbicides etc. and to improve the land shown in the above photograph.  In doing so, she will be able to earn a better income and give her children a limitlessly  better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides etc. and to improve her land.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es:
Doña Lili desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de ropa, en una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa de habitación. Tiene 3 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y han formado sus familias. 

En su tienda, Carmen Lili vende ropa variada, para mujeres, varones y niños, su meta es lograr incrementar las ventas de su negocio, lo que logrará a través de la inversión en capital de trabajo, para lo cual solicita el crédito. Espera en un futuro poder ver su negocio más grande y establecido en un local con mayores condiciones.
texts.en: Lili has been earning a living by selling clothing in a small shop located in her home for several years. She has three children who are now independent and have their own families. In her shop, Lili sells a variety of clothing for women, men, and children. Her goal is to increase sales, which she will achieve by investing in her business, and this is why she is requesting the loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and establish it in a better location.

loans.use: to buy clothing as an investment in her business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 5 años de edad y su hijo de 9 años de edad. José se se dedica a la venta de pan francés de forma ambulante y este negocio es lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Tiene 10 años de recorrer las calles vendiendo pan y gracias a esto ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con muchos clientes que cada día demandan más el pan que distribuye. Con el deseo de mejorar su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de una nueva bicicleta para recorrer las zonas ofreciendo el pan francés. Espera poder contar con este crédito y hacer la inversión lo antes posible.
texts.en: José is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, his 5-year old daughter, and his 9-year old son. José earns a living by selling french bread as a street vendor, and this business allows him to support his household. He has been selling bread in the street for 10 years and thanks to this, he has a lot of experience and many customers who request more and more bread from him.
