José wants to improve his business, and is therefore requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a new bicycle in order to get to the areas where he sells french bread. He hopes that he will receive this loan and be able to make the investment as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle for his business.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de totopostes (panes tostados hechos de maíz) desde 5 varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha cliente pues sus productos son muy buenos y aprecios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Sandra esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios para seguir elaborando los totopostes como: maíz, huevos, manteca, azúcar, etc. por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Sandra, 31 years old, lives with her husband and three children in a house they own. She has been making and selling “totopostes” (toasted pieces of bread made from corn) for about 5 years. Her business is located at a market near her residence. She has many customers because her products are very good and accessibly priced. She uses her earnings to cover some of her household expenses.

Sandra is requesting a loan to purchase necessary ingredients wholesale, such as corn, eggs, butter, sugar, etc., to continue making “totopostes,”. This will enable her to continue with her business. It is her only source of work and allows her to give her family what it needs, without limitation.

loans.use: to buy corn, eggs, butter, sugar, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support her coffee crops during the new season.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un joven emprendedor, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en Ucayali junto a su esposa y su hijo.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como Agricultor, teniendo como principal cultivo el Plátano, vendiéndolo a un muy bien precio. Tiene muchos conocimientos acerca de la agricultura es por eso que produce productos de calidad.Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por ello lucha constantemente para darle todo lo mejor a su familia.
Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para poder realizar el mantenimiento del cultivo (abono, plaguicidas) hasta la etapa de la cosecha y con esto pueda obtener mayores ingresos que más adelante lo utilizará para comprar más terrenos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is a young entrepreneur. He is 25 years old, and lives in Ucayali with his wife and son. For several years, he has been working as a farmer. His main crop is bananas, which he is able to sell at a very good price. He has a lot of agricultural know-how, which allows him to grow high quality products. He has a strong desire to do well, and because of this, he is constantly striving to provide his family with the best. 

Jose is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help, he will be able to buy the supplies needed to maintain his crops (fertilizers, insecticides) until harvest time. This will allow him to increase his earnings, which he will use in the future to buy more land and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizers, insecticides) to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 34 anos de idade solteira mãe de 4 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, ainda responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
É negociante há bastante tempo, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material como: cimento, área, chapas e pedrinhas. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra, mobilar a sua casa e abrir uma mercearia para venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade. O seu principal desafio é garantir a escolaridade dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Celina was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She is 34 years old and is a single mother to four children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for a niece who lives with her.
Celina has run her own business for some time, and she uses her earnings to pay for household expenses. With this loan she hopes to continue working on a home construction project by buying materials such as cement, sand, metal sheets and small stones. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku (Kiva Field Partner).
In the future, Celina would like to finish this construction project, furnish her house, and open a grocery store that sells essential home goods. Her biggest challenge is to guarantee that her children will be able to attend school up to college.

loans.use: continue to work on her construction project by buying materials like cement, sand, metal sheets and small stones.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de restaurant à l’image de AMINATA qui est la seule personne assise sur la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités vente de restaurant : viandes, haricots et riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
AMINATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de viandes, choux et poivres. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité vente de restaurant.
texts.en:
DJIGUIYA is a group of the SIGUIKAFO Association of Tiele.  It comprises married women who have known one another through ties of friendship and neighborhood.  On average, these women are 29 years old and they have two children each.  They are involved in various activities, such as the preparation of food for example, which is the case of  Aminata, (the only woman in the front row in the photo).  They live in large traditional families in Tiele, in the rural commune of Baguineda (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

The women of the Djiguiya group have been involved in retail for several years and they receive a high demand from their customers. They prepare dishes made with meat, rice and beans.  Eager to meet the increasing demand of their customers, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program.  This is their first solidarity loan.

Aminata, the group's president, is well-known in Tiele, for the quality of the food that she prepapes.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two bags of rice and a large quantity of meat, cabbage and peppers.  She buys her supplies in Bamako and sells her dishes locally and on a retail basis, in Tiele.  Her customers are both men and women and she gets paid in cash or on credit.  

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest the rest of the money in her food preparation activity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es: Oscar tiene 32 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hijo de 2 años de edad. Oscar es un hombre trabajador y visionario quien se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés. Gracias al apoyo que recibió por parte de FUSAI en el pasado, logro mejorar su negocio y ahora gracias al incremento de la demanda que ha tenido solicita nuevamente este crédito para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pan dulce y francés para satisfacer una mayor demanda y de esta forma seguir creciendo en el negocio y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Expresa estar muy agradecido del apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Oscar is 32 years old and lives in a house he owns with his life companion and his two-year-old son. Oscar is a hardworking and visionary man who sells sweet bread and French bread.

Thanks to the support he received from FUSAI in the past, he was able to improve his business and now, thanks to the rise in demand he has had, he is requesting a loan again to invest in purchasing a greater quantity of sweet and French bread to meet the higher demand. In this way he will continue expanding his business and providing his family with better living conditions. He says he is very grateful for the support he has already received.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of sweet and French bread.

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, borradores entre otros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cuadernos, libros, lapiceros y borradores.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “KUTIMUY” communal bank.  It is located in Cusco District, which is a part of Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Sra. Antonia is one of the members.  She is single, 64-years old and has two children.  Her business is a bookshop.  She sells notebooks, books, pens, erasers and other items.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  She has had her business for five years already, and it is going very well for her.  Sra. Antonia's dream is to expand her bookshop.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase notebooks, books, pens and erasers. 

The other members of the communal bank make their livings with the following businesses: selling sweets, clothing sales, a grocery store and a bookstore. 

Sra. Antonia is grateful for those who are helping to make her dream come true through this loan.  She promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, books, pens and erasers.

loans.name: Nieve Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nieve, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 16, 15, 12, 11 Y 9 años, 4 estudian en colegio y los menores en  escuela, todos  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Nieve con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, papas fritas, sodas, jugos y batidos de frutas, con ella trabajan dos personas más a quienes les paga un sueldo por su trabajo.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que el otro le dio muy buenos ingresos con lo cual pudo ayudar a su hermana que tuvo que operar a su hijo de urgencia y ella no tenia y Doña Nieve con sus ganancias pudo solventar estos gastos lo cual le salvo la vida a ese pequeño.  Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí Province, has long enjoyed a reputation as the city of tamarinds because the region used to produce so much of the fruit. Portoviejo is also where the the Jesús De Nazaret Credit Group meets twice a month, and where 34-year-old Señora Nieve lives. She is married to a mechanic, and the couple has six children who all live at home, ages 18, 16, 15, 12, 11, and 9. The four older children are in secondary school and the younger two are still in primary school. 

Doña Nieve started a business to generate her own income, and sells hamburgers, french fries, sodas, juice, and fruit smoothies. She has two employees who work with her and receive a salary.  

Doña Nieve is applying for another loan as her previous one boosted her income significantly and allowed her to help her sister, whose son needed emergency surgery. Doña Nieve's earnings covered the cost of her nephew's medical care, which saved the little boy's life. 

Doña Nieve will use the funds from this loan to purchase supplies that she needs to prepare the food she sells. She been through four loan cycles with the Credit Group and is pleased with the support that the loans provide her. Doña Nieve aspires to have her own cafe.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün is married with twin four-year-olds. Since the time the children were born she hasn’t been able to work, but would now like to contribute to the family’s economy by selling spiced sausage similar to pepperoni. Working in this way she can take care of the children as well as receive additional income. With this loan she will buy spiced sausage similar to pepperoni. In the future, when her children are older, she would like to open up a small shop in order to provide more financial support for her family.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Nilgün Hanım evli ,altı  ve dört yaşında iki çocuk annesi.  Çocukları küçük olduğundan çalışamadığını ama aile bütçesine katkı sağlamak için evde çevresine,arkadaşlarına sucuk satışı yapıyor.Böylelikle hem çocuklarına vakit ayırıp hem de gelir elde ediyor.  Aldığı kredi ile sucuk alacak.  Amacı çocukları biraz daha büyüdüğünde bir dükkan açmak ve çocuklarına daha iyi bir gelecek sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy spiced sausage similar to pepperoni

loans.name: Sadiye

texts.en:
Sadiye is married and is the mother of three daughters between the ages of 30 and 36. As a housewife, Sadiye goes to her daughter's café every day in order to help her, and does errands and other small tasks to help her out. But this year she wants to work for herself and so she has rented a stall along the waterfront from the municipality. At this stall she is going to sell small electronic gift items, and she is also thinking of selling beaded jewelry. With the loan she gets from Maya, Sadiye is going to pay the rent for her stall and purchase merchandise. She is very happy that she’s going to have her own business at her stand. “For years, I have always helped out my children and remained on my feet, but it hasn’t been visible. I’m happy that now I’m going to have my own business and earn my own money,” she said. In starting her business, she wants to make good use of her time and to generate income. But her main goal is to succeed in her work.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Sadiye Hanım evli en büyüğü otuz altı ,en küçüğü  otuz yaşında üç kız annesi.  Sadiye hanım ev hanımı olup her gün kızına yardımcı olabilmek için Poyraz kafe ye geliyor ve alış veriş ve ufak işlerde kızına yardımcı oluyor.  Bu sene kendisine çalışmak istemiş ve belediyeden  sahilde kendisi için bir tezgah kiralamış.  Bu tezgahta orijinal küçük elektronik hediyelik eşyalar satacak.  Aynı zaman da boncuk işi takılarda satmayı düşünüyor.  Aldığı kredi ile tezgah yeri kirasını ve satacağı ürünleri alacak.  Tezgahta kendi işini yapacak olmasından çok mutlu:“Senelerdir hep ayaktayım ve çocuklarıma yardım ediyorum ama görünürde hiçbir şey yok.  Artık kendi işimi yapıp kendi kazancımı elde edeceğim için mutluyum”ifdadesini kullandı.  Bu işte bir başlangıç yaparak hem zamanını değerlendirmek hem de gelir elde etmek istiyor. Ama en büyük hedefi bu iş de başarılı olmak.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stall

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene 20 años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Maria es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. Ella  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Maria, 58 years of age, lives with her husband and two children in a house they own. She has a tortilla making establishment in her home and has had the business for 20 years. She has a large customer base since she provides excellent service and is very friendly with the people who visit her. She always has a smile on her face for them. She is also very adept at making tortillas and waits on customers quickly.

Maria is very dedicated to her business. For her, the most important battles in life are those that we fight every day to fulfill our dreams. She is ready to make every effort for her goals and thus she is requesting a loan from INTEGRA that will enable her to purchase corn wholesale so she can continue producing. She hopes in this way to provide her family with economic security.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias las unas con las otras, trabajan juntas en actividades, y se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Mercedes es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a vender cosméticos, vive con su hijo y su marido en casa propia. Comenta que es una familia muy trabajadora, donde todos se ayudan para poder salir adelante y tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
 La Sra. Mercedes solicita  este préstamo para invertir en  nuevos productos de cosméticos, para así traer más variedad de catálogos y productos para incrementar más sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called ENTREPRENEURIAL WOMEN, and consists of women who live in the city of San Ignacio. The members are very close and feel a great solidarity; they collaborate in various activities, and help each other succeed.  

Señora Mercedes is the group's president and sells cosmetics. She, her husband, and their son live in the family's own home. Señora Mercedes describes her family as very hardworking. Like her colleagues in the Entrepreneurial Women Group, the family members support each other to achieve success and a better life free of hardships. 

Señora Mercedes is applying for this loan to invest in new cosmetic products. She wants to offer a greater variety of cosmetics in order to increase her sales and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BENKOLA de (COULOU), OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de TENIMBA qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à COULOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : oignons, choux, poivre et tomate. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
TENIMBA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaire de différente sorte.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
SABOUGNOUMA is a group which is part of the BENKOLA Association of Coulou, Ouelessebougou. It comprises married women who have known one another through ties of friendship and neighborhood. On average, these women are 31 years old and they have five children each. They are involved in various activities, such as buying and selling condiments for example, which is the case of Tenimba (in the front row, first from the left).  They live in large traditional families in Coulou, in the commune of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

These women have been involved in retail for several years and they receive a high demand from their customers. They buy and sell food products such as onions, peppers, cabbage and tomatoes.  Eager to meet the increasing demand of their customers, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is their sixth solidarity loan.

Tenimba, a member of the group, is a very well-known retailer in Ouelessebougou.  She is planning to use her loan to buy a large quantity of various food products.  She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and sells her goods in Ouelessebougou, on a retail basis. Her customers are both men and women and she gets paid in cash or on credit.

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest the rest of the money in her activity.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet in his home.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina has been operating her own school and office supplies business for more than 15 years, and she earns well. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She and her husband work hard, with the determination of earning a better income to provide their children with a better education. 

In order to increase sales, Felina is requesting a new loan for PHP 12,000 to purchase additional school and office supply products to sell. These include  more quantities of pens, bond paper, poster boards and other supplies needed in her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Felina hopes to increase her inventory and product sales. She also wants to help save up for her children and give them a better future.

Felina meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Krizza Mia

texts.en:
Krizza Mia is a hardworking daughter and is studying in a university, taking up a BS in Hotel and Restaurant Management. 

Krizza Mia has two siblings; she is the second child, and is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of family. Her father worked as a driver, and her mother is a businesswoman.

She is requesting this loan to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester. Her goal is to find a better career where she could earn a better income for their own.

In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, meet Timothy. He is a father of 4 who practices mixed farming on a small piece of land in Nyamira, where he lives together with his family. Timothy has been a farmer for 32 years! He keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows tea. During tough times, he engages in other small businesses to make ends meet. He sells milk, eggs and tea at the local market. 

Timothy is seeking a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. Poultry is a very lucrative business that is constantly growing. He tried his hand at poultry and he found he was very successful. He is planning to purchase more chickens to expand his agribusiness. With your loan, Timothy will increase his output and keep his clients happy and make more income in the process. Additional income from this expansion will be plowed back into the business for growth. His family will enjoy an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Née en 1974 à YANFOLILA, MINATA vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux à MANA dans une  famille traditionnelle dans la commune rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU. 
MINATA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce de céréales. MINATA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales : arachide, niébé, mil, fonio et maïs.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les trois prêts précédents, MINATA est à son quatrième  prêt de stockage commercialisation avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, MANA, MORIDJAMBOUGOU et N’KOROBOUGOU) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place, qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à OUELESSEBOUGOU et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
MINATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Minata was born in 1974 in Yanfolila, and she lives in a traditional family, in Mana, with her husband and her seven children.  Mana is located in the rural commune of Ouelessebougou.

Minata got involved in income-generating activities from an early age.  She learned from one of her aunts who was a grain seller and she worked with her for many years.  Later on she decided to buy and sell her own grains: groundnut, black-eyed peas, millet, maize and fonio.

Having duly repaid three previous loans, Minata is now taking her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  This commercial / storage loan will be used to buy 20 bags of millet from rural producers (in Ouelessebougou, Mana, Moridjambougou and N'korobougou) and also occasionally from local wholesalers.  She will store her grains for at least three months.  Minata resells from home, in Ouelessebougou and at the local markets, on a retail basis and mostly to consumers.  She is paid in cash and on credit.

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs which will be used to help her husband to support the family, to repay the loan and to reinvest the rest of the money in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Maria Adelina

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieto, la hija le ayuda económicamente, Maria se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar d residencia, tiene mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hija logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y gallinas por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas, y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, who is 56 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter and her grandson. Her daughter helps her economically. Maria sells chickens and hens in the market that is located near her home. She has many customers. With what she obtains from her sales and with the help of her daughter, she manages to pay the expenses of her household. Maria is applying for a loan to purchase more chickens and hens wholesale in order to be able to continue with her sales and thus be able, along with her family, to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and hens wholesale

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
SIGUIDIA est un groupe de l’association BENKOLA de COULOU, OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de KOUMBA qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à COULOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grains de néré. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
KOUMBA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de grains de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle  s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et vend ses produits à BAMAKO et SENEGAL par sac de 100kg, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de grains de néré.
texts.en:
SIGUIDIA is a group which is part of the BENKOLA Association of Coulou, Ouelessebougou. It comprises married women who have known one another through ties of friendship and neighborhood. On average, these women are 40 years old and they have four children each. They are involved in various activities, such as buying and selling "néré"(locust beans) for example, which is the case of Koumba (in the standing row, first from the right). They live in large traditional families in Coulou, in the commune of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

These women have been involved in retail for several years and they receive a high demand from their customers. They buy and sell "néré" beans.  Eager to meet the increasing demand of their customers, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their second solidarity loan.

Koumba, a member of the group, is a very well-known seller in Ouelessebougou. She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 bags of "néré" beans.  She buys her supplies in Ouelessebougou and resells her merchandise, by 100 kilo-bags, in Bamako and in Senegal.  She sells to both men and women and is paid in cash or on credit. 

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest the rest of the money in her business.

loans.use: to buy some "néré" (locust beans) .

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine previously accessed a 55,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. With the loan that she borrowed, she was also able to buy a tricycle and was able to improve her house. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. As a single parent, she works hard to provide for her family.

She would like to apply for another 55,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jasmine dreams to have another store and hopes to have an improvement in their way of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

Norma has been in this business for seven years. Norma earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear and raising livestock.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, and zippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and affordable cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Zosi

texts.en:
Zosi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Muoykea

texts.en:
Muoykea is 34 years old and a married woman with four children. She lives in Rokhak Kiri District, Battambang Province, in Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business on farmland located in Sdok Pravoek Village. The daily income of her family is USD 7 a day.

Muoykea wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: For more than seven years, Julie has been operating her own farm for a living. She earns a better income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer, knowing that she needs to improve the farm to have a greener garden.  She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Dwighta

texts.en:
Dwighta has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for many years and she earns well from this. She sustains all of her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Dwighta would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Dwighta hopes that her business will last for several more years. She also desires to start other businesses so that she can continually help her family.

She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rhenalyn

texts.en:
Rhenalyn is 25 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rhenalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, bread, cookies, noodles, etc., to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. 

Rhenalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, bread, cookies, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old, married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her food business.

Edna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is single and has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.  Rosevilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computers

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a widowed woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Zaragul

texts.en: Zaragul was born in 1972. She is a hardworking and good-natured woman. Zaragul is a careful mother of two children. She and her husband always try to provide their children with all the necessary things. Zaragul has been busy selling children's clothes. Zaragul sells a variety of children's clothes such as shirts, trousers, blouses, etc. She has been busy with this business for more than seven years. Every season she renews her assortment of goods because the business struggle in a local market is big. Zaragul is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy children's clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Adriana Asencion

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 49 años de edad, actualmente  mantiene una relación de unión libre, ella tiene dos hijos de 22 y 17 años los mismos que son de otro compromiso, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es maestro soldador. 
Doña Adriana realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de soldadura  donde elabora puertas, ventanas y cualquier tiempo de estructuras con el metal, nunca le falta trabajo ya que tiene muchos clientes. Ella por su parte en las tardes y noches traba en un local de venta de comidas rápidas con lo cual se gana algo porel bien de su familia.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ellos pueden financiar su negocio y con lo cual obtienen las ganancias para salir adelante. Este crédito es para comprar metal, pinturas, soldaduras y otros materiales para elaborar sus obras. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les sirven de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds because of the large quantity of this fruit. This group, known as the Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret, meets every 15 days in Portoviejo.
Adriana lives in Portoviejo. She is 49 and in a relationship. She has two children, ages 22 and 17, from a different relationship. Her youngest is in school. Her partner is a master welder.
Adriana is taking out a loan for her husband to use in his work. He has a welding shop where he makes doors, windows, and all kinds of metal structures. He is never without work because he has many clients. Adriana works evenings and nights at a local fast food store, where she makes some money for her family's well-being.
She is taking out another loan because this is how they have been able to finance their business, which provides them with a good income in order to get ahead. This loan is for the purchase of metal, paint, solder, and other materials for their work.
She has been part of this loan circle from the beginning and she likes it because the loans are a great help for her.

loans.use: to buy metal, paint, solder, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and resell

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 19-year-old lady living in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her family consisting of 13 members. She is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems and she is in her first year. Najah is seeking a loan to be able to pay for her upcoming semester fees as she noticed that her family is facing financial problems. She is planning to work in her study field in the future so that she can support her family.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kuña Tekove Group

texts.es:
Kuña Tekove se llama este grupo, es un comité que gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo de todas ya están en su ciclo número 15. Todas ellas están luchando y esforzándose por poder salir adelante, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y trabajando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir, que está mejorando gracias a su trabajo y ganas de superación. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida, que con mucho y sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo.
La Sra. Olga Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de  insumos para  su negocio, como ser bebidas, lácteos, frutas, verduras y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener una mejor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Tekove. It is a committee that, thanks to the work and effort of everyone, is already in its 15th loan cycle. All the women are striving and exerting themselves to be able to advance, and they are also doing the survey on eliminating poverty, striving and working to improve. 

One of the members is Señora Olga, who in her last survey showed a level of poverty within level 3, that is to say, she is improving thanks to her work and will to achieve. She is a very hard-working person. She works in sales, since she has a well-stocked grocery store that with much sacrifice and effort has been growing.

Señora Olga will use this loan for the purchase of stock for her business, such as beverages, dairy products, fruits, vegetables, and other items, which will help her to have a greater variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, fruits, vegetables, and other items to stock her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more merchandise needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children while her income from the business is assisting with their everyday expenses. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelly dreams of having a bigger connection and hopes to have a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras está en el  ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo están mejorando su situación de vida.
Luisa, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de productos varios y lencería, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela. Su esposo también es comerciante por lo tanto también ayuda, y de esa forma están mejorando sus vidas, es una familia muy trabajadora y unida.
La Sra. Luisa solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta, y también de lencería en general ya que tiene mucha clientela de la zona, y quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Working Women) is in it's 4th cycle of the women's committee program where all of them work and help each other move forward. They are working toward eliminating poverty and, thanks to their jobs and efforts, they're improving their quality of life.

One of the members, Luisa, has been selling various products and lingerie for some time and has a good clientele. Her husband is also a businessman, so he helps out, too, and together they are improving their lives. They are a very hard-working, unified family

Luisa is requesting this loan to buy various products that she will sell and also lingerie in general because she has many clients in the area and she'd like to be able to fill their orders.

loans.use: buy various products to sell and lingerie.

loans.name: Samanta Solange

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Samanta, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 7 años de que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es contratista.
Doña Samanta es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para tener sus propios ingresos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos L”eudine (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, perfumería y productos naturales). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta en sus momentos libres, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cosméticos, cremas  y productos de belleza. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the loan group Jesús de Nazaret meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, because of the great quantity of these fruits that there were at that time.

Señora Samanta lives in this place. She is 37 years old and is married. From this relationship she has a 7-year-old daughter who goes to school. Her husband is a contractor.

Doña Samanta is a woman who likes to look out for herself in order to have her own income. She sells L'Eudine products (beauty articles, cosmetics, creams, perfumes, and natural products). Her form of sales is door to door in her free time. She leaves items on credit and collects every one or two weeks. She has had this business for three years, and with it she is getting ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics, creams, and beauty products. She has been in the loan group for three cycles, and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her dreams are to give the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum is 35 years old, and a married woman with three children. She lives in Bakan District, Pursat Province, which is located in the western part of Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business on approximately two hectares of farmland. It is the sole source of their income. They have been in this occupation for eight years.

Sum wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family, by having a latrine to use. There is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva, to build a latrine and buy its fixtures. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other, general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive con su hija y nieta, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes y ropa para damas y caballeros, desde hace más de 10 años, su hija le apoya en esta actividad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería de variedad y de esta manera surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Marleni is 56 years old and is separated. She lives with her daughter and granddaughter in a large community in the urban zone of Zaña. Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling groceries and clothing for women and men for more than ten years. Her daughter helps her in this business. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3500 PEN to buy a variety of merchandise and in this way to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise and in this way to stock her business.

loans.name: Floranie

texts.en:
This is Floranie, 34, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Ryan, a project coordinator, and together they manage their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Floranie operates an electronic gadget retail / wholesale business. She buys cell-phone units or other gadgets from suppliers, then she sells them with a little profit. Her products are mobile handsets, tablets, and other gadgets of that kind. She also offers watches, accessories, clothing, cosmetics, and electronic loading service (prepaid mobile phone minutes). Customers are attracted to buy, due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy an additional stock of mobile phone units, and other items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.

Floranie hopes to have her own boutique or store, where she could house all her items. She also desires to become a real estate broker. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional mobile phones and other electronic gadgets for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more blankets, pillows, cushions and sheets, for her shop

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
Milagros se llama este grupo, forma del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Idalina, quien a través de las constantes capacitaciones, sumado a su arduo esfuerzo y su entusiasmo es que está mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la lavandería, y de esa forma se está ganado la vida de una forma digna y decorosa. 
La Sra. Idalina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Jabones, suavizantes, cepillos de ropas, detergentes y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo de lavandería, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo y con los que podrá seguir luchando y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Milagros" (miracles). It is part of the program to eliminate poverty, where everyone is doing the survey on the elimination of poverty in order to be able to understand the situation of each one of them.

One of the members is Señora Idalina, who through the constant training, added to her hard work and her enthusiasm, is improving her situation with regard to poverty. She has a laundry, and in this way she is earning a living in a dignified and decent way.

Señora Idalina is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of soaps, softeners, clothes brushes, detergents, and other supplies in order to continue with her laundry business and continue striving to improve her living conditions. She is grateful for this opportunity that they are receiving and with which she will be able to continue striving and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soaps, softeners, clothes brushes, detergents, and other supplies.

loans.name: Shukriya

texts.en: Shukriya is 23 years old. She is a smart and hardworking young woman. She is not married and lives with her parents and brother. She graduated Medical Collage, and for more than one year she has been working in a local hospital, as a nurse. Shukriya likes her job and works with pleasure. She since childhood had dreamed of being a doctor. Now, she realized her dream. Shukriya is happy now. She is going to help her brother, because he is a student of the first course and he must pay for his university tuition. Shukriya is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to pay the tuition of her brother. She awaits your mercy, and in advance thanks you.

loans.use: To pay the university tuition of her brother

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widow with one child who is an adult. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over five years Umazi has operated a fruits and vegetables stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. The rains and seasonality are her main challenges to her operation.

Umazi decided to join Yehu to access their loans so as to boost her business. She is applying for a 40,000 KES loan to buy additional green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old married man who supports a family of five children. His wife works to help support the family. John operates a charcoal business which has been in operation for two years, earning himself an income of 10,000 KES a month.

John was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer who is now servicing his client’s first loan of 20,000 KES. John will use it to add more charcoal to his stock so he can keep up with his customers’ demands. He plans to use the anticipated income to expand his business and educate his children.

John hopes to have a bright and successful future and provide the best quality education possible to his children.

loans.use: to add more charcoal to his stock

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María Elizabeth tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto con su hijo a su cargo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche que ella misma prepara, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el frente del mercado de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción civil para el arreglo de su sala que le permitirá tener un lugar agradable para residir.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth is 44 years old and lives with her partner and her son in Oyotún District, in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast. Many people in this community are farmers, ranchers, and shopkeepers. 

María Elizabeth sells ceviche that she prepares herself, and has set up a business in front of the market in her neighborhood. She has applied for a loan of 4,000 New Soles from the microfinance lender Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of construction materials. María Elizabeth plans to make repairs to her home so she'll have a more pleasant place to live.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Carlin

texts.es:
Carlin tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en edad escolar, en su casa propia de material rustico en el Caserío de Huancas – Querocotillo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta al comercio de abarrotes como arroz, aceite, leche entre otros, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevo soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 3 school-aged children in his own house constructed of rustic materials. They live in the village of Huancas – Querocotillo, located in Cutervo Province, belonging to the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Carlin sells groceries like rice, oil, milk, amongst others. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to offer his clients.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to offer his customers.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través de la cual podrán conocer la situación de cada y conforme a ello poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y que mediante ello puede dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio está mejorando sus condiciones de vida, ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás tipo de prendas, ya que de esa forma podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, y seguir luchando por crecer.
texts.en: This group is participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey, through which they can learn what the situation of each member is and from that can learn and improve their living conditions. One of the members is Maria who sells variety of clothing and doing this provides her family with everything she could not have. She is a hard-working woman who with great effort and sacrifice is improving the conditions of her life, helping her family. Maria is requesting this loan so she can invest purchasing jeans, T-shirts, shirts, pants and other types of clothing. In this way she can offer greater variety to her clients and continue to struggle to grow.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, pants and other types of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, desde hace más de 3 años, en los distritos aledaños a su residencia, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de aceite y cambio de llantas de su vehículo y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio
texts.en:
Pedro, 58, is married and lives in the house he owns with his wife and children. They live in a big community in the urban area of Cayalti, whose inhabitants work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. They are located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

For the last 3 years, he's offered public transportation in his own mototaxi in the districts around his residence. He's requesting a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy oil and a tire change for his vehicle, and by doing that, offer a better service.

loans.use: buy oil and a tire change for his vehicle.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 53 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y su hija de 14 años de edad, la cual estudia en Colegio secundario del Caserío Viza, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad ubicada cerca al río Marañon, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercialización de animales menores cuyes, gallinas, patos y lo comercializa los días domingos en el mercado del distrito de Santo Tomás y en los restaurants de la zona, adicionalmente cultiva maíz amarillo duro criollo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para cría (cerdos) con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 53 years old. She has a stable household alongside her partner and her 14-year-old daughter, who goes to the secondary school of the town of Viza, in a rural zone of the district of Santo Tomás, a community located near the Marañon river. Its population works in agriculture and livestock raising, and it is part of the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and ducks, and she sells them on Sundays in the market in the district of Santo Tomás and in the restaurants in the zone. In addition, she raises native yellow hard corn.

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 PEN to purchase small animals (pigs) to raise, with which she will obtain greater income to thus be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Zayton

texts.en:
Zayton has run her sari-sari, or variety store, for six years, and she makes a good income from this. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs, especially for her three children. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

To improve sales, Zayton would like to apply for a new loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed to stock her store. Zayton hopes to see her store thrive, and she dreams of seeing her children complete their studies. She sincerely extends her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for CCT assistance.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There clients such as Zayton share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy

loans.name: Mohamad Adib

texts.en:
Mohamad Adib is a 40-year-old married father of two. He left his home country of Syria in an effort to find better work opportunities in Lebanon. Mohamad Adib is a hard-working man who has worked as a painter in a construction company since 2013. His 25 years of experience have provided him with a good quality of skills and experience, yet his income is barely enough to cover the increasing demands of his family which is financially dependent on him.
  
Mohamad Adib acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay the medical fees for a surgery he needs to undergo in the coming weeks. 

Mohamad Adib is an ambitious man and dreams of better living standards for his loved ones. He hopes he will be able to make more improvements in his career by establishing his own workshop in the future.

loans.use: To pay the medical fees for a surgery he needs to undergo in the coming weeks.

loans.name: Denbagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Denbagnouma est composé majoritairement de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (mangues, oranges et bananes), beurre de karité et habits. Dans l’intention de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits (mangues, oranges et bananes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 kg  de bananes,  5 sacs de mangues et 2sacs d’oranges en gros au bord du fleuve de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Sabalibougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Kadia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Denbagnouma is composed mostly of polygamous women, who average 47 years of age and six children each. All the women live in Sabalibougou, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties in their neighborhood. The group members have small-scale businesses involving fruit (mangoes, oranges, and bananas), shea butter, and clothing. 

Intending to renew their cash supplies, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Kadia (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling fruit (mangoes, oranges, and bananas). She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 kg of bananas, 5 sacks of mangoes, and 2 sacks of oranges wholesale at the riverside in Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base in Sabalibougou. 

With this loan, Ms. Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 110,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase  a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Mougnou Ani Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Mougnou ani sabali est constitué de quatre (4) femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 43 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Farada l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce de, fruits et légumes  (mangues et bananes), condiments, arachides et habits.  Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Massan (assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits et légumes dans le marché Banconi-Farada. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 100kg de bananes et 10 sacs de mangues. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Banconi-Farada au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Massan compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame Massan compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
This group “Mougnou ani sabali” is composed of four women, who are all married and living in monogamous households. They average 43 years of age and seven children each, all living in Banconi-Farada, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members do commerce in fruit & vegetables (mangos and bananas), condiments, peanuts, and clothing. 

With the goal of replenishing their funds, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Ms. Massan (sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling fruit & vegetables at the Banconi-Farada market. She intends to use this loan to purchase 100 kg of bananas and 10 sacks of mangos. She gets her supplies in Bamako. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash in Banconi-Farada. 

With this loan, Ms. Massan plans on making an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet the needs of her children. The rest will be invested in her work. She is counting a lot on the Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en: Sohiba was born in 1975. She is married and bringing up two children. Sohiba graduated from medical collage. She has worked in a local hospital in her region for more than 10 years. Sohiba is a nurse. She is a very hardworking woman. Sohiba and her family live poorly because the family's income is small. Sohiba is ill now. She must go to a doctor but she has no money. She really needs your financial support. Sohiba is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy medicine for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her treatment

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
Mastona is an ambitious woman. She is married and bringing up four children. Her husband gets a small salary. So, it is not enough to provide their children with all necessary things. 

Mastona decided to start her own business and in this way to find an additional source of income for her family. She is going to start a business with animal husbandry. She lives in a village and that’s why she has a good opportunity to develop a business in this aspect. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. 

Mastona is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy cattle and organize her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle and organize a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used appliances to resell in his store

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
Jose Felix tiene 46 años de edad, vive al lado de su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos de 14, 11, 6 y 4 años de edad, su casa es propia de material rustico, vive en una comunidad pequeña y mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad, del Caserío San Lorenzo del Distrito Pimpingos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva 1,5 has de cafeto de la variedad catimor, hace tres años de edad, su predio se ubica cerca su vivienda, tiene experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago del mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Felix is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and their 4 young children, ages 14, 11, 6, and 4. The house is theirs and is made of rustic material. He lives in a small community called Caserío San Lorenzo, which is in the Pimpingos district. He has good relationships with the members of his community. The people here work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production. It is located in the Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Jose Felix works in agriculture. He cultivates 1.5 hectares of Catimor coffee. For 3 years now, his land has been located near his home. He has experience in this field. He is requesting a loan from "Edpyme Alternativa" for 2,000 soles to pay for maintenance of his crops and this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to hire day laborers for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 23-year-old lady living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her family consisting of eight members. She is a university student majoring in Art and she is in her fourth year. Bushra is one step closer to reaching her goal of working in her study field so that she can start supporting her family. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Because Hanan is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Hanan was born in 1963. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. One of her daughters is a university student majoring in Monuments and Tourism, and she is only one step close to reaching her goal of graduating to start supporting her family. Hanan is now seeking a loan to help her daughter who is appearing in the picture to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les six (06) femmes du groupe Badegna sont toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako; elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (Friperies) de toutes qualités et céréales. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (Friperies) de toutes qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 balles de friperies en gros à Médine ;  la revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Badegna are all married and living in polygamous households. The women average 49 years of age and six children each, all living in the Sabalibougou area, in the district of Bamako.
