And they know one another through neighborhood ties and through their revenue-generating businesses at the Sabalibougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing (used) of all qualities; and grains. 

With the goal of renewing their cash supplies, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan. 

Ms. Aminata (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling clothing (used) of all qualities. She intends to use this loan to purchase 3 bales of secondhand clothing wholesale in Médine. By hawking, her sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women paying with cash or credit in Sabalibougou. 

With this loan, Ms. Aminata plans on making an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her work and ensuring her children’s care at home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing (used).

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages plyogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sikoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako; elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sikoroni. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies) de bonnes qualités, du charbon de bois et de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramata  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de bonnes qualités ; elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 balles à Médine  en gros. La revente se fait à Sikoroni  et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ramata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Dembagnouma are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 38 years of age and six children each, all living in Sikoroni, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through neighborhood ties and through their revenue-generating businesses at the Sikoroni market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving good quality clothing (used), charcoal, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of renewing their cash supplies, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan. 

Ms. Ramata (sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling good quality clothing (used). She intends to use this loan to purchase 3 bales wholesale in Médine. By hawking, her sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women in Sikoroni. 

With this loan, Ms. Massan plans on making an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her work and covering her children’s healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to resell

loans.name: Thourk

texts.en:
As a farmer from Batheay District Kampong Cham Province, Thourk, 62 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. Thourk has three children of whom two are already married. Her husband is also is a farmer in the same field. This couple can earn approximately $3 (USD) a day. Being a farmer is the main task that she has done for more than thirty years to make her living.

In this farming season, Thourk is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Thourk is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seed, insecticides, and other related materials. Thourk thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and other related materials

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre (4) femmes, les membres du groupe Balimaya sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sikoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, chaussures plastiques de toutes sortes, bananes plantains, restauration et charbon du bois. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso et sont  à leurs  4ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Assan (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété dans la vente de chaussures plastiques de toutes sortes au marché de Sikoroni. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 700 paires de chaussures plastiques de toutes sortes.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché.  Elle mène ses activités à Sikoroni au comptant  et à une clientèle mixte. Madame Assan compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 80 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
Composed of four women, the members of the group Balimaya are for the most part married and living in polygamous households. The women average 39 years of age and three children each, all living in Sikoroni, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through tontines and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members run different revenue-generating businesses, especially involving plastic shoes of all kinds, plantains, and firewood, and they work in food service. 

Concerned about expanding and growing their businesses, they decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan. 

Ms. Assan (sitting at the  far right in the  photo) is famous for selling plastic shoes of all kinds at the Sikoroni market. She intends to use her loan to purchase 700 pairs of plastic shoes of all kinds. She gets her supplies at the big market. She runs her business in Sikoroni and sells to a mixed customer base paying with cash. With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA  that will be used for supporting herself, and the rest is for her business. Her goal is to create a loyal partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to take advantage of many loans.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes of all kinds

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 23-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarm city. He has been working with his family raising sheep for the past five years. It is a very good business and the whole family cooperate together. It is a good business and the income is high but it still needs a lot of improvements. 

Moath took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to build another enclosure and expand the family business. By taking this loan Moath will be able to improve the enclosure and also improve the family's living conditions. 

Moath appears in the photo in the family enclosure.

loans.use: to build another enclosure and expand the family business raising sheep.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father of four kids. Eyad has a store selling computer accessories in the city. He opened it five years ago.  It is a very good business and the demand is high. Eyad would like to improve the store and expand it in the future.
 
He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more computer accessories and laptop bags to resell in his store. By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to improve his store and increase the sales.
 
Eyad appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more computer accessories and laptop bags to resell

loans.name: Ana Marita

texts.es:
Ana Marita tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Zaña, una población ubicada cercana al valle del río Jequetepeque, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de raspadillas por la mañana y en las tardes prepara champu, cachangas y avena, su negocio está ubicada en la puerta de su domicilio, es conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos con la venta de leche y quesos.
texts.en:
Ana Marita is 40 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own house with her husband and children in the district of Zaña, located in the Province of Chiclayo, belonging to the Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people in this valley of the Jequetepeque river work in agriculture, commerce and raise cattle.

She works selling snow cones in the morning and in the afternoon she prepares champu (a traditional dessert), cachangas (a fried bread) and oats. Her business is located in the door of her house and she is known in the neighborhood for her work. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2500PEN to buy a cow that will permit her to generate more income selling milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy a cow to sell milk and cheese.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in transport and rentals as well as a butcher shop. He faces challenges of limited capital. Besides that, he hopes to construct a residential house. Charles needs a loan to buy land for construction.

loans.use: to buy land for construction.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Lilia has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods like kakanin, puto, kutsinta (rice cake) and other delicacies within the local community, particularly at the school campus. 

She is 56-years-old and blessed with three children. Due to financial insufficiency, she wants to make her business profitable in order to earn a sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice, sugar, milk, coconut, flour and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell.

Through patience and hard work, Lilia believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, coconut, flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: 10 De Diciembre  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 10 de Diciembre. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general. Ellos decidieron unirse para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la institución y con los créditos  mejorar  sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Antonia, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 17, 15, 14 y 9 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Antonia es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por sus propios medios y  con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido, ella tiene a cargo el bar en una escuela de la localidad, allí de lunes a viernes prepara todo tipo de alimento saludable además de jugos de frutas lo cual es muy nutritivos para los niños que a diario consumen sus alimentos, lleva dos años con este negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y frutas necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Este es el segundo  ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para todos en el grupo. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area called Estancia Vieja in Colon Parish of the city of Portoviejo the members of the "10 de Diciembre" communal bank get together every fortnight. This place has humble people who work in agriculture and commerce in general. They decided to get together to be able to access the benefits offered by the institution and through the loans improve their businesses.  

One of the members is Antonia who is 33 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has 4 children from this relationship aged 9, 14, 15 and 17. The three oldest study in secondary school while the youngest is in Primary school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Antonia is a hard-working woman who has always strove to get ahead through her own efforts. She helps her husband with her earnings. She is in charge of the canteen at the local school.  From Monday to Friday she prepares all kinds of healthy foods and also fruit juices which are nutritious for the children who consume her products daily. She has been doing this for two years. The loan is to purchase fruits and foods necessary to prepare the meals. 

This is the second cycle for this communal bank and they like it as the loans are very helpful for all the group. Their dreams are to provide better education for their children.

loans.use: to buy food and fruits.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en: Malohat lives with her family in north Tajikistan. She learned sewing in her parent’s house. After her marriage, this ability has become the source of her family's income. Her husband is a master at repairing houses and his income is small. Malohat has been busy with sewing more than 15 years. She also has an animal husbandry business. She began her animal husbandry business four years ago. She works hard to earn a living. Malohat is going to increase her working capital and maximize her profit this way. She is asking for a loan of 1,200 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en el sexto ciclo del programa de comités, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Andresa es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de lencerías varias, y por medio de ello ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y procura una vida digna y sin privaciones. Andresa es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando.
La Sra. Andresa pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencerías varias, para poder surtirse, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is in the sixth cycle of the committee program, they are also in the poverty elimination program, where they are performing a poverty elimination survey or each of the members.

Andresa is one of the members and she sells different types of lingerie.
Through this business she has been able to help her family and give them everything she was previously unable to- a dignified life without deprivation. Andresa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

Andresa is requesting this loan to invest in buying various types of lingerie to stock her wares so she can continue with her sales, and continue to fight to improve the living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees and to purchase educational materials for her daughter

loans.name: Judy Betty

texts.es:
Judy Betty, tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente junto con sus dos hijos a su cargo, en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 11 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha soliciato un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cuyes, patos, pavos, gallinas y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Judy Betty is 41 years old. She lives with her partner and her two dependent children in her own house in the Oyotun district, a rural area located in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. The population there primarily works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

She makes a living raising and selling farm animals. For the past 11 years, her business has been located in the back of her house. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 nuevos soles to buy guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys, and chickens. In this way she will increase sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys, and chickens.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 53-year-old mother who was gifted with six children. She runs a small retail store to help her husband in generating income. She aims to further improve the business and generate sufficient income to support the education of her children. She wants to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she does not have enough capital. 

For this reason, Julia is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of soft drinks, breads, milk, juice, canned goods, seasonings, eggs and noodles to sell. She believes that, someday, she will make more improvements to her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, bread, milk, juice, canned goods, seasonings, eggs and noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing another refrigerator to cool water and to make ice

loans.name: Tobius

texts.en:
Tobius is a hardworking 35-year-old man with six children. He and his family live in Fort Portal, Uganda.

To earn a living, he sells agricultural inputs and everyday goods to his customers. He explains that his primary business challenge is insufficient capital.

He is seeking this loan to purchase additional goods, such as cleaning supplies, baby lotions, and basins. In the future, he dreams of building a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., cleaning supplies and baby lotions)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new computer and educational equipment for her youngest child

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Michael, who is in his early 30s, is married and has three children who are still in school. He has been running a business selling fruits and vegetables for four years now.  He works from 5 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be MichaeI's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in his fruits and vegetable business. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is doing fine with the loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. He dreams of buying land and building his own house.

Michael will share this loan with his loan group "Machimbo" with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teófila tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el distrito de Morropon, en su propia casa junto a su esposo, su comunidad es tranquila de clima caluroso, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, tamales y chicha de jora, así como a la crianza de aves de corral actividad que realiza desde hace mas de 5 años, con el apoyo de su esposo lo comercializan en el mercado de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de harina y materiales de construcción para la mejora de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un mejor lugar donde residir.
texts.en:
Teófilais 36 years old and lives in the Morropon district, she lives in her own home with her husband. Their community is a peaceful one with hot weather. She works in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade, and is located in the province of the same name belonging to Piura, in the northern region of Peru. 

She sells food, tamales and chicha, in addition to raising poultry for the last 5 years. With the support of her husband she sells them in the market of her district.

She has applied for a loan of 1,500 soles to purchase flour and supplies to improve her home so as to have a better place to live.

loans.use: Buy flour and supplies for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to purchase educational equipment for her youngest daughter

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29-year-old married man. His wife, Keziah, contributes additional income to the family by operating a grocery business. They are blessed with three children, who are eight, five and two years old.

To earn a living, for four years now, Paul has been operating a second-hand clothing shop. By doing so, he usually earns approximately 50,000 KES per month.

Paul is now seeking his third loan, this time in the amount of 110,000 KES, from VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan proceeds to add more stocks of clothes for re-sale purposes and to buy a motorcycle to more easily get around town for work and family obligations. Any profits he earns as a result of the loan would be used to expand his wife’s green grocery business and to educate his children. He hopes to be a successful businessman and to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick used the previous loan to buy iron sheets and to pay workers who are constructing his house. His main business is transport, alongside farming, in order to boost his income. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning and to provide his family with a good home. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, windows, doors, and sand for his house

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, windows, doors and sand for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an efficient and cost-effective liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy package.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, pipes, lavatory, toilet, etc. for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to repair the stable

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan, age 43, is married and a father of five young children. He comes from one of the minority communities of Kosovo and works as a police officer. He lives in a very old and small house and has not been able to renovate it with his own salary, therefore, he is requesting a loan in order to expand his house and add extra  annex rooms. 

Milan has always wanted to improve their conditions, but has not had the opportunity before. He hopes that the loan will contribute to the improvement of his living conditions and he is very grateful for this opportunity. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To expand his house and add extra annex rooms

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 43-year-old married woman from Gaza.  She lives with her husband and six children - four sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in a public firm where he gets a low income. Awatef opened her own project to help her husband in part with the family's expenses. She has a store for renting wedding materials like chairs, tables and other decoration materials. It is a very good business and the demand is high, especially in the summer. 

Awatef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more chairs for her business. By taking this loan, Awatef will be able to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. 

Awatef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chairs for her business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan also helped in her household expenditures. She continues to work hard to provide for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angeline dreams to have another branch for her store and hopes to become rich. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en: Genna is 33 years of age, married and has four children. They currently reside in a rural community. To have additional income, she engages in direct selling of personal collections within her community. Being a kind and friendly mother, there are many customers who make an order with her. In this regard, she would like to acquire more stock of the said products to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more stock of personal collections to sell. Through this loan, she believes that her business will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal collections to sell

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en: Bashar is 21-years-old. He is a university student majoring in Media, and he is in his fourth year. Bashar is only one step away from getting his Bachelors. He plans to work in his field after graduation so that he will be able to support his family that consists of five members. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Somaly is 41-years-old and married. She lives in a rural village in the Sangke district of Battambang. She has two children. She has been involved in rice farming for 15 years and it is her main source of income. She is able to earn about 55,000 KHR per day. 

Somaly has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. With success, she has paid back the entire loan which helped her support the daily expenses of her household, especially having decent food. Now, she is leading a group of two to seek a new loan. As the leader, Somaly wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. Somaly hopes that the prices of her crops will increase soon, so she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 22-years-old. He is a university student majoring in Class Teaching, and he is in his second year. Khaled lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family that consists of eight members. Because of his sense of responsibility, he plans to support his family in the future by finding a job that suits his study. He currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers for his internet cafe

loans.name: Meriton

texts.en:
Meriton is a single, 20-year-old male who lives with his mother in a small village. His father lives and works in a western European country to support the family. Meriton is also very hardworking and supports his family. He plants corn on the land he has, to use and sell, and also has a green house to grow different vegetables since the money that his father sends them is not enough to pay the daily expenses and save for Meriton’s future and goals.

Now, Meriton is requesting a loan to purchase a fence to place around his yard and land. This loan will help him to improve the agricultural business and he hopes that he will be able to expand his land even more and cultivate different products to sell. He hopes that it will help him to become independent from his family and he really appreciates the help.

loans.use: To purchase a fence to place around his yard and land

loans.name: Kholigul

texts.ru: Холигул фермер из района Яван. Ей 41 год. Она женщина с открытым лицом и с чистой совестью. У нее двое сыновей и одна дочь. Старшему сыну 17 лет и он сейчас находится на заработках в России. Дочери 11 лет и младшему сыну 8 лет, они учатся в школе. Муж Холигул является членом дехканского хозяйства. Сама Холигул на протяжении 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Муж помогает ей в деятельности. Сейчас они заняты сбором урожая пшеницы. На место него они собираются провести очередной посев. С такой целью Холигул обратилась за кредитом, на сумму которого она хочет купить качественные семена и минеральные удобрения. Благодаря кредиту Холигул сможет вовремя провести очередной посев. За счет прибыли с деятельности она планирует сделать маленький ремонт в доме и немного улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Kholigul is a farmer from the Yavan Region. She is 41 years old. She is an open-faced person with a clear conscience. She has two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is 17 years old; he is currently in Russia as a migrant worker. Her daughter is 11 years old, and the youngest son is eight years old; both attend school. Kholigul's husband is a member of a cooperative farm. Kholigul has been growing farm produce for eight years. Her husband helps her in the business. At present they are busy harvesting wheat. Afterwards they intend to do another planting. This is why Kholigul has applied for a loan to buy quality seeds and mineral fertilizers. Thanks to this loan Kholigul will be able to complete planting in time. She plans to use her revenues in order to carry out some minor home renovations and thus improve their living conditions somewhat.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and mineral fertilizers for the planting season.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans à Banconi-Farada l’un des quartiers de Bamako; elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi-Farada. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce,  du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffage, arachides et friperies. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de charbon et du bois de chauffage ; elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 chargements du bois de charbon et du bois de chauffage dans les villages environnant de Bamako  en gros. la revente se fait  à Banconi-Farada au comptant et crédits à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabougnoma group are married and living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 44 years old, with four children. They all live in Banconi Farada, a neighborhood of the town of Bamako. They know each other as neighbors and vendors at the local market. The group members sell charcoal, firewood, peanuts and used clothing. With the goal of restocking their goods for cash, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Mrs. Mariam (the one seated on the far left in the photo) is well known as a charcoal and firewood vendor. She plans to use her loan to buy two loads of wood for charcoal and firewood wholesale in the villages near Bamako. She resells in Banconi Farada, for cash and on credit, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Mariam plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy wood in order to produce firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw olive wood for her souvenir workshop

loans.name: Shahribony

texts.en:
Shahribony is good natured person. She lives in an agricultural area and has been busy with an agricultural business for more than six years. 

Shahribony feeds cows. She has a cowshed in her house where she keeps cattle. Shahribony manages this business alone. She has additional income from sewing and provides sewing services to local people. 

Shahribony and her husband are raising two children. She is the main feed keeper of her family. Shahribony is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy cattle for increased working capital. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increased working capital

loans.name: Reem

texts.en: Reem is 21 years old. She is a university student in her second year, majoring in office management. Reem wants to support her family, which consists of five members, by working in her field of study after she gets her bachelor's degree. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nergjivane

texts.en: Nergjivane is the married mother of three children, two girls and one boy. Currently she is employed as a nurse in a clinic and also works after hours and on off days in a private company. Her husband works in agriculture and still, the money that they generate together is barely enough to meet their daily expenses, as the children’s needs are high, especially for education and nutrition. At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to renovate their house, specifically the stairs, which have been damaged for quite some time now. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Allakandeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Allakandèmè est composé de 2 femmes monogames et 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 90 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Samè et  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Salimata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Allakandèmè group is composed of two women living in monogamous families and two women living in polygamous families. On the average, they are 34 years old, with four children. They all live in Samè, a neighborhood of the town of Bamako, and know each other as neighbors. The group members sell clothing (traditional colorful "pagnes" wax fabric). With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Mrs. Salimata (the second one seated from right to left in the photo) is well known as a vendor of clothing (traditional "pagnes" wax fabric). She plans to use her loan to pbuy 90 sets of "pagnes" wholesale at the main market. She resells in her neighborhood,  retail, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs.  Salimata  hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 85,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business. Her goal is to continue the collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and eventually buy a land plot to build a home.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for her last semester.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Roen is a villager from the Thmor Koul district, where crop farming is common. She is 62 years old and has six children. Roen is a rice farmer and has been in this business for 35 years. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Roen is a client who has already received four loans. The loans have helped her make a living better. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops, in order to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Marije

texts.en:
This is Marije, a 46-year-old villager, with two of her youngest children.  She has five girls ages 21, 19, 17, 15 and 11. 

Marije works in agriculture, planting (mainly beans and seasonal veggies) and also animal husbandry, with the focus on pigs and cows. Her clientele is spread in the villages around. 

What you see in the background of the photograph is the so called "family’s house." They live very primitively. However, when it comes to tradition, including children’s weddings, this is very dominating in northern Albania where Marije comes from. Rural people especially follow it to the letter. 
 
Marije wants this loan to pay for her the wedding expenses of her oldest daughter who works at the fish factory. The loan will also cover dressing her daughter and preparing the dowry.

loans.use: to pay for her oldest daughter's dowry and wedding expenses, according to the rural northern tradition

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lassa l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 80 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Lassa et à une clientèle mixte. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Siguidia group consists of five women, for the most part married in monogamous households. They are on average 38 years old with three children. They all live in Lassa, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Members of the group trade in clothing and charcoal. To build up their stock-in-trade, group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling all kinds of pagne wax clothing (colorful West-African fabric). She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale 80 lengths of pagne wax fabric in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Lassa to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested into the business. In her relation with Soro Yiriwaso her objective is to buy a plot of land for building purposes.

loans.use: To buy all kinds of clothing (pagnes wax fabric)

loans.name: Dondouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dondouma est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates concentrées, aubergines et persils) et fruits. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Koniba (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates concentrées, aubergines et persils). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 boites de tomates concentrées, 5 sacs d’aubergines  et  3 corbeilles de persils en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Samè et  à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame  Koniba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Dondouma group consists of married women living with their husbands and children in traditional families. They are on average 45 years old with seven children. They all live in Samè, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship.

Members of the group are small retail merchants who deal in condiments (tomato concentrate, eggplants and parsley) and fruit. To build up their stock supplies, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Koniba (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a good reputation selling condiments (tomato concentrate, eggplants and parsley). She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale 5 boxes of tomato concentrate, 5 bags of eggplants and 3 baskets of parsley in Médine. Retail sales are conducted in Samè to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Koniba hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 95,000 CFA francs, to be fed back into the business and used to meet the children's small needs.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old and married to Kennedy, who produces additional income for the family. They are blessed with three children, aged 12,10 and 3 years.

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which she will use to buy more stock of bags and cosmetics for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children, and at the same time, expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nièta est majoritairement composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies) de meilleures qualités, de condiments, ustensiles et pommes de terre. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramata (femme arrêtée en 3èmeposition de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait à Samè et à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame  Ramata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Nièta group consists for the most part of married women living with their husbands and children in nuclear families. They are on average 38 years old with six children. They all live in Samè, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship.

Members of the group trade in quality second-hand clothing, condiments, kitchen utensils and potatoes. To build up their stock-in-trade, group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Ramata (the woman in the third position from right to left in the photo) has a great reputation selling quality second-hand clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale two bales of second-hand clothes in Médine. Retail sales are conducted in Samè to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Ramata hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, to be fed back into the business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak, 36, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Moungkul Borey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Vannak and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice and working for others for a fee for several years, earning about 60,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to spend for the family’s needs.
 
This is Vannak’s group loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and plow the field. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow the field

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. As a mother, she has to struggle to support her family via farming rice and working construction work. She has been involved in this business for seven years and currently is able to earn about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.
 
Vy has had one previous loan with VisionFund and completely repaid it. The past loan helped her improve her family's standard of living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy construction materials for supporting her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for supporting her business

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 36, is married with three dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and growing tobacco. To supplement the income, she also works as a paid worker. She has been running her business for 16 years, earning about 36,000 KHR (Camboidan riels) per day, and she is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

Leap is in her second microloan with VisionFund. Now she is seeking another loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her tobacco and rice so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy various products and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a business premises and more groceries in bulk quantities to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with his family, which consists of five members. Mahmoud is a university student majoring in Science and Technology Information, and he is in his second year. Mahmoud is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees so that he will continue his study and work in his field in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.
